Specialty Crafting (Stonemasonry).description:
Your training focused on Crafting one particular kind of item. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Crafting checks to Craft stone items. If you are a master in Crafting, this bonus increases to +2.

Sample Items: Stone goods and structures

If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides. Some specialties might apply only partially. For example, if you were making a morningstar and had specialty in woodworking, the GM might give you half your bonus because the item requires both blacksmithing and woodworking.

Advanced Kata.name: Advanced Kata
Advanced Kata.description:
You gain one monk feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your monk level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another monk feat.

Explosive Expert.name: Explosive Expert
Explosive Expert.description:
Access You are from Dongun Hold or Alkenstar.

You have continued training in volatile weapons and gained a deeper understanding. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency for simple and martial bombs and firearms.

Mistsoul.name: Mistsoul
Mistsoul.description: You have a connection to vaporous forms of water, such as fog and mist. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.I9k9qe4gOT8UVK4e]{Mist Blending} reaction.

Analyze Idiolect.name: Analyze Idiolect
Analyze Idiolect.description:
You break down a specific individual's idiolect, memorizing their speech mannerisms and habits.

If you interact with someone for at least 10 minutes, when you later attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} that individual, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to your Deception checks and DCs. Due to the intense character study required, you can't remember more than one idiolect at a time.

Legendary Survivalist.name: Legendary Survivalist
Legendary Survivalist.description: You can survive indefinitely without food or water and can endure severe, extreme, and incredible cold and heat without taking damage from doing so.

Order Spell.name: Order Spell
Order Spell.description: You gain the initial order spell from your order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.

Wind-Tossed Spell.name: Wind-Tossed Spell
Wind-Tossed Spell.description:
You enhance your spell with elemental air, using the wind to find your target and carry your magic around cover.

If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that requires a spell attack roll, you ignore the target's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition and any cover they have from you.

The spell gains the air trait.

Flamboyant Leap.name: Flamboyant Leap
Flamboyant Leap.description:
Requirements You are capable of using a finisher.

You stylishly leap and deliver a powerful finisher.

Make a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} and attempt one single-action finisher at any point during your jump; the finisher can't be one that includes other movement, such as Mobile Finisher.

Immediately after the finisher, you fall to the ground if you're in the air, even if you haven't reached the maximum distance of your jump. If the distance you fall is no more than the height of your jump, you take no damage and land upright.

When attempting a High Jump or Long Jump during a Flamboyant Leap, determine the DC using the Long Jump DCs, and increase the maximum distance to double your Speed, rather than just your Speed.

Advanced Arcana.name: Advanced Arcana
Advanced Arcana.description:
You gain one wizard feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your wizard level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another wizard feat.

Vibration Sense.name: Vibration Sense
Vibration Sense.description: Your eidolon gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet. If aquatic, it gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]{Wavesense} as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet instead. If amphibious, it gains both.

Aboleth Transmutation.name: Aboleth Transmutation
Aboleth Transmutation.description: You have tapped into the ancient magic used by alghollthu masters (also known as aboleths) to mold the flesh of your ancestors. You can use this magic to transfigure other beings. You gain 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.RvBlSIJmxiqfCpR9]{Feet to Fins} and 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.MZGkMsPBztFN0pUO]{Water Breathing} as arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these arcane innate spells once per day.

Quick Contacts.name: Quick Contacts
Quick Contacts.description: You know where to go, who to talk to, and how to make new connections, fast. Upon entering a new settlement, spending 1 day of downtime allows you to build enough connections to make use of the Connections or Underworld Connections feats. If you're legendary in Society, you can form the required connections within 1 hour of entering a new settlement.

Advanced Targeting System.name: Advanced Targeting System
Advanced Targeting System.description: Your ocular processors are augmented with advanced targeting systems, which allow you to more easily pinpoint your enemy and read their movements. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike} once per day as a 1st-level arcane innate spell.

Sap Life.name: Sap Life
Sap Life.description: You draw the life force out of your enemies to heal your own wounds. When you cast a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damage at least one living creature, you regain Hit Points equal to the spell level of your harm spell. If you aren't a living creature, you gain no benefit from this feat.

Vitality-Manipulating Stance.name: Vitality-Manipulating Stance
Vitality-Manipulating Stance.description:
You have learned to attack meridians and pressure points like your rival Shino Hakusa. You gain a vitality blast ranged unarmed Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[negative]]]{1d4 negative damage}, has a range of 30 feet, and has the unarmed and versatile positive traits.

Additionally, when you use Stunning Fist, instead of saving against being stunned, you can choose to have the target make a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following results. You must choose to do this before the target rolls its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's muscles become temporarily weaker. For 1 round, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and any time it attempts to take an action with the manipulate trait, the action is disrupted unless it succeeds at a flat check with a DC equal to 5 + its enfeebled value.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute, the flat check is DC 11, and the target takes –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds for the duration.

Expert Disassembler.name: Expert Disassembler
Expert Disassembler.description: You can apply the same techniques you use to reverse engineer objects to disable them. You can use Crafting instead of Thievery to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Device} or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock}.

Soaring Flight.name: Soaring Flight
Soaring Flight.description:
Frequency: Once per day.

To be a tengu is to be unburdened by the concerns of the world below. You grow a pair of magical wings or expand your existing ones. For 5 minutes, you gain a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} Speed equal to your land Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Climbing Claws.name: Climbing Claws
Climbing Claws.description: You can extend your claws to aid you in climbing. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.

Soul Arsenal.name: Soul Arsenal
Soul Arsenal.description:
Choose an additional soulforged armament of a different type than the type you already chose, and choose one essence power for it. Upgrade and change armaments individually.

When you Manifest Soulforged Armament, you can summon any number of your armaments (you must meet the Requirements for each), and when you Dismiss the effect, you can choose to Dismiss some and not others. You can choose to manifest the essence form of any number of your armaments when you take the action. Each armament can manifest its essence form only once per day.

When you gain soulforged corruption, choose one armament's corruption flaw to affect you for stage 1. At stage 2, you take the flaws of all your soulforged armaments. While you have the curse, each armament gets a separate flat check to manifest its essence form, and failing prevents you from manifesting only that armament's essence form.

Special You can select this feat a second time at 12th level or higher, choosing the final item type.

Basic Martial Magic.name: Basic Martial Magic
Basic Martial Magic.description: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level magus feat of your choice.

Mariner's Fire.name: Mariner's Fire
Mariner's Fire.description: You conjure uncanny orbs of spiritual flame that float above or below the water's surface. You can cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame} cantrip as a primal innate spell at will, heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can cast this cantrip underwater.

Virtuosic Performer (Dance).name: Virtuosic Performer (Dance)
Virtuosic Performer (Dance).description:
You have exceptional talent with one type of performance. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when dancing. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2.

Example performances Ballet, huara, jig, macru

If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.

Deflecting Shot.name: Deflecting Shot
Deflecting Shot.description:
Trigger An ally within the first range increment of your firearm or crossbow is hit by an attack, and you can see the attacker.

Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm or crossbow.

You're always ready to take a quick shot to deflect a weapon or distract a foe enough to render them off target. The ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack. You use this reaction after the result of the attack roll is revealed, so you know whether the +2 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through}will make a sufficient difference.

Timeless Nature.name: Timeless Nature
Timeless Nature.description: With primal magic sustaining you, you cease aging. The overflowing primal energy gives you a +2 status bonus to saves against diseases and primal magic.

Scout's Warning.name: Scout's Warning
Scout's Warning.description:
Trigger You are about to roll a Perception or Survival check for initiative

You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger, granting them each a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on whether you use gestures or call out, this action gains either the visual or auditory trait, respectively.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.RxDDXK52lwyHXl7v]{Effect: Scout's Warning}

Swift Elusion.name: Swift Elusion
Swift Elusion.description:
Trigger A foe ends its movement adjacent to you.

Attempt an Acrobatics check against the foe's Reflex DC. If you succeed, either @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} to a different space adjacent to the foe or move the foe to a different space adjacent to you.

Enlarge Companion.name: Enlarge Companion
Enlarge Companion.description: You make your companion enormous. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8rj45fKzCFcB0fxs]{Enlarge Companion} warden spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Divine Weapon.name: Divine Weapon
Divine Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger You finish Casting a Spell using one of your divine spell slots on your turn.

You siphon residual spell energy into a weapon you're wielding. Until the end of your turn, the weapon deals an additional 1d4 force damage.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Force)}

You can instead deal an additional 1d6 damage of an alignment type that matches one of your deity's alignment components. As usual for aligned damage, this can damage only creatures of the opposite alignment.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.OkcblqWj4aHVAkrp]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Chaotic)}

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.AclYG5JuBFrjCY3I]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Evil)}

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.dvOfGUuvG8ihcN8d]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Good)}

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.GlpZyxAGhy5QNqkm]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Lawful)}

Wish Alchemy.name: Wish Alchemy
Wish Alchemy.description:
You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes.

Once per day when you use @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Pe0zmIqyTBc2Td0I]{Advanced Alchemy} during your daily preparations, you can spend a batch of infused reagents to create a wish vial containing a single common arcane spell of your choice of 8th level or lower.

The spell must have a casting time of no more than 3 actions, no Cost, and must be able to target you. Only you can Activate the wish vial, which takes the same number of @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} actions as the spell's casting time and grants you the effects of the spell.

Disciple of Shade.name: Disciple of Shade
Disciple of Shade.description: You've delved deeper into the mysteries of shadow and become blessed with magical power that increases your skills in the arts of deception and persuasion. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YQWq1DZuLRk32M3h]{Inscrutable Mask} domain spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Athletic Strategist.name: Athletic Strategist
Athletic Strategist.description:
You know how to calculatedly manipulate joints and body weight. In addition to using @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.m0f2B7G9eaaTmhFL]{Devise a Strategem} to modify a Strike, you can use it to modify a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempt, substituting your Devise a Stratagem roll for the Athletics check. You must apply the substitution to the first eligible attack you make, whether it's a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} or one of the Athletics actions.

You can also use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength for the Athletics check when you substitute your Devise a Stratagem roll, unless you're using a weapon for the maneuver and the weapon doesn't fit the restrictions for using Intelligence with a stratagem.

Sculpt Shadows.name: Sculpt Shadows
Sculpt Shadows.description: You coax nearby shadows into the shape of a simple weapon or a simple tool or item, using a tiny piece of your shadow to make it solid; in doing so, you lose 1 Hit Point. You can create only level-0 common, non-consumable weapons, or adventuring gear with no intricate parts, written text, or other complicated components. The item lasts until used for a single activity, until you Sculpt Shadows again, or for 1 minute, whichever comes first. Once the duration expires, the object dissipates, and you regain the lost Hit Point unless the item was Broken or Destroyed. As the object holds a tiny sliver of your shadow, you can't recover the lost Hit Point until after the object dissipates.

Fortuitous Shift.name: Fortuitous Shift
Fortuitous Shift.description: You have grown more comfortable with your penchant for supernatural disappearance. The flat check DC of your Fortuitous Shift feat decreases to 11, and you are no longer @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} if you succeed.

Magus Dedication.name: Magus Dedication
Magus Dedication.description:
You cast spells like a magus, gaining a spellbook with four common arcane cantrips of your choice. You gain the Cast a Spell activity. You can prepare two cantrips each day from your spellbook. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the magus archetype, add a spell of that level or lower to your spellbook. You're trained in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs. Your key spellcasting ability for magus archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are arcane magus spells. You become trained in Arcana; if you were already trained in Arcana, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in simple weapons.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the magus archetype.

Sow Spell.name: Sow Spell
Sow Spell.description:
You fold your spell into a seed. If your next action is to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} using 1 action or 2 actions, the spell instead plants itself in an adjacent square. You must make all decisions regarding the spell at the time you cast it.

Within the next 10 minutes, you can direct your sown spell to sprout and produce the spell's effects as a reaction, which is triggered when a creature enters the sown spell's space or a square adjacent to it.

You can have only one sown spell at a time, and if you don't trigger the spell within 10 minutes, it dissipates and the spell is lost. A creature can notice the sown spell with a successful Perception check against your spell DC.

Signifer's Sight.name: Signifer's Sight
Signifer's Sight.description: The magic flowing through your signifer's mask allows you to see in the dark, and the mask dampens the distraction caused by sudden flashes of bright light. While wearing your signifer's mask, you gain darkvision. Additionally, if you are dazzled while wearing your signifer's mask and the target is concealed only because you are dazzled, you reduce the flat check DC to target that creature from 5 to 3.

Walk The Plank.name: Walk The Plank
Walk The Plank.description:
You frighten a foe into moving where you want them, traditionally demanding they walk the plank. Attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} an opponent; this check gains the incapacitation trait.

On a success, in addition to the normal effects, you can also force the target to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} up to its Speed. You choose the path the target takes, and it does so as part of your Walk the Plank action. You can't force the target to move into a harmful space (one where it will take damage, fall, provoke reactions, or similar) unless the result of your check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} was a critical success.

The target then becomes temporarily immune to Walk the Plank for 24 hours.

Shared Overdrive.name: Shared Overdrive
Shared Overdrive.description: You've experimented enough on your teammates to transfer a substantial number of powered-up gizmos to them, enabling one of your allies to benefit from the full effects and duration of your Overdrive. The first time you use Overdrive Ally during a given Overdrive, the effect lasts for the remainder of the duration of your Overdrive, instead of just until the end of the target's next turn. Any further uses of Overdrive Ally during the same Overdrive have their normal duration, per Overdrive Ally.

Parthenogenic Hatchling.name: Parthenogenic Hatchling
Parthenogenic Hatchling.description: You were hatched from an unfertilized egg during hard times for your people, and you are a biological copy of your mother. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent disease. Each critical success against an ongoing disease reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease. You take damage only every 2 hours from thirst and every 2 days from starvation, rather than every hour and every day.

Attunement Shift.name: Attunement Shift
Attunement Shift.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Requirements Your previous action was to cast a spell with the air, cold, earth, fire, plant, or water trait.

The magic of your spell floods into you, overriding your connection to the land around you. You alter your terrain attunement to a terrain that matches a trait of the spell you just cast. You thereby gain your terrain attunement benefit when you cast further spells with the same descriptor, instead of using the terrain you're actually in. For instance, if you cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tanglefoot}, your terrain attunement switches to your choice of forest or swamp, and your terrain attunement applies when you cast another plant spell.

Your terrain attunement reverts to that of the terrain you're in 1 minute after you use Attunement Shift.

Champion's Sacrifice.name: Champion's Sacrifice
Champion's Sacrifice.description: You can suffer so that others might live. You can cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.USM530HlzZ1RMd99]{Champion's Sacrifice} devotion spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Incredible Companion (Ranger).name: Incredible Companion (Ranger)
Incredible Companion (Ranger).description: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble or savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion.

Torch Goblin.name: Torch Goblin
Torch Goblin.description: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage. You can light yourself thoroughly on fire with a held torch, a bottle of alchemist's fire, or a similar incendiary, dealing yourself [[/r 1d6 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}. As long as you are suffering @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, all your melee attacks against adjacent creatures deal an additional 1 fire damage per weapon damage die. Any creature that successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapples}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trips} you takes 1d6 fire damage; if it uses a weapon for that action, the weapon takes the damage instead. You must still attempt the flat check to remove the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} each round, as normal.

Amphibious Form.name: Amphibious Form
Amphibious Form.description: Your eidolon adapts to life on land and underwater. It gains the amphibious trait, allowing it to breathe in water and air and to avoid the normal -2 penalty for making bludgeoning and slashing unarmed Strikes underwater. It gains a swim Speed equal to its land Speed or 25 feet, whichever is less; or if it is normally aquatic, it gains a land Speed equal to its swim Speed or 25 feet, whichever is less.

Rockslide Spell.name: Rockslide Spell
Rockslide Spell.description:
You enhance your spell with elemental earth, causing chunks of stone to litter the ground.

If the next action you use is to Cast a non-cantrip Spell that affects an area, a number of 5-foot squares in the area equal to the spell level become difficult terrain for 1 round. These squares must be on the ground, and the entire area of difficult terrain must be contiguous.

The spell gains the earth trait.

Flourish And Ruin.name: Flourish And Ruin
Flourish And Ruin.description: You can call upon the vital essence of your spirit to restore life to your allies and call forth vines to ensnare and bludgeon your foes. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.x5rGOmhDRDVQPrnW]{Field of Life} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.JbAcSLu62TU1OgNF]{Tangling Creepers} as 6th-level primal innate spells once per day each. You become an expert in primal spell attack rolls and primal spell DCs.

Boost Modulation.name: Boost Modulation
Boost Modulation.description: You aren't satisfied with keeping to just one kind of boost from your constant tinkering, so you've learned to modulate between several possibilities at once. Choose two additional offensive boosts. You can use an Interact action to change the offensive boost currently affecting your weapon, choosing between the one you chose for the class feature and the two you chose for this modification. If your weapon has the modular trait, you can swap the offensive boost as part of the Interact action you take to use that trait.

Flexible Transmogrification.name: Flexible Transmogrification
Flexible Transmogrification.description: You've learned how to transmogrify your eidolon to suit the circumstances of the day. Each day, choose one evolution feat of 6th level or lower during your daily preparations. Your eidolon gains that feat until your next daily preparations.

Uzunjati Recollection.name: Uzunjati Recollection
Uzunjati Recollection.description: You tell a story spontaneously from nearly forgotten facts, delving into your memory and entertaining your audience in the process. Recall Knowledge with a skill in which you have master proficiency, then use Uzunjati Storytelling with the same skill. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your skill check for Uzunjati Storytelling from the added details.

Disk Rider.name: Disk Rider
Disk Rider.description:
When you cast floating disk, you can modify its duration to be sustained, up to 10 minutes. If you do, add the following heightened entry to its effects.

Heightened (3rd) The disk can hold up to 10 Bulk. The spell no longer ends if you ride atop the disk (though it does if any other creature rides atop it, including if the creature is riding on you). If you are riding the disk, it changes its capacity to hold you, plus additional Bulk equal to the maximum you could carry without being encumbered. If you ride atop the disk, you can direct it to move along the ground up to 30 feet or your Speed, whichever is slower, each time you Sustain the Spell. While you ride atop it, the disk can move over liquids as long as it ends its movement on solid ground. If it ends its movement on a surface that can't support it, the spell ends.

Aerial Pilerdriver.name: Aerial Pilerdriver
Aerial Pilerdriver.description:
Requirements You have a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Heaving both yourself and your opponent into the air, you bring them crashing to the ground. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. This Strike deals [[/r {1d6}[additional]]]{1d6 additional damage} per weapon damage die, and it has the following additional effects on a success, failure, and critical failure.

Success The target lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Failure You lose your grip on the target, and it is no longer grabbed or restrained by you.

Critical Failure You lose both your grip on the target and your balance. You fall prone, and the target is no longer grabbed or restrained by you.

Deimatic Display.name: Deimatic Display
Deimatic Display.description:
Imitating animal threat displays, you make yourself appear larger and more imposing.

Roll one Intimidation check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} and compare the result to the Will DC of each animal, fungus, and plant creature in a 15-foot cone. When you do, Demoralize gains the visual trait, and creatures are affected if they can see you. You don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

Master Spotter.name: Master Spotter
Master Spotter.description: Your incredible perception and trusty enhanced visual gear allow you to see things others miss. Your proficiency rank in Perception increases to master.

Dedication to the Five.name: Dedication to the Five
Dedication to the Five.description: Your dedication to @Compendium[pf2e.deities.JndhOIHnQoMwnsw3]{The Godclaw} borders on a cleric's. You gain the cleric's @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.hT4INKGtly4QY8KN]{Domain Initiate} feat but must select perfection, protection, tyranny, or zeal as your domain. In addition, you can use any religious symbol of @Compendium[pf2e.deities.d56paSkcwvll2OhR]{Abadar}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.QRkcFciCOmFoxF1B]{Asmodeus}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.eErEiVmBqltYXFJ6]{Iomedae}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.qqqrbq4uCrelQvgH]{Irori}, or @Compendium[pf2e.deities.sZrdzh0ANQnZGXJb]{Torag} as your divine focus.

Bless Tonic.name: Bless Tonic
Bless Tonic.description: You channel positive energy into restoratives that ward against harm. When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} an alchemical item that restores Hit Points (rather than create it with advanced alchemy, Quick Alchemy, or another means), it becomes a blessed alchemical item and gains the positive trait. For example, an @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.hDLbR56Id2OtU318]{Elixir of Life} would become a blessed elixir of life. When a creature regains Hit Points using a blessed alchemical item, the overflowing energy grants them negative resistance 5 for 1 round, or negative resistance 10 if you are legendary in Crafting.

Stab and Blast.name: Stab and Blast
Stab and Blast.description:
Requirements You're wielding a firearm with an attached bayonet or reinforced stock, a fire lance, or a combination weapon.

You slice or smash your opponent with the melee portion of your weapon before pulling the trigger at point-blank range. Make a melee Strike with the required weapon. If the Strike is successful, you can immediately make a ranged Strike against the same target with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. This counts as two attacks toward your multiple attack penalty, but you don't apply the multiple attack penalty until after making both attacks.

Inspirational Focus.name: Inspirational Focus
Inspirational Focus.description: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

Dwarven Doughtiness.name: Dwarven Doughtiness
Dwarven Doughtiness.description: You are either naturally calm and collected in the face of imminent danger, or you are very good at faking it. At the end of your turn, reduce your @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition by 2 instead of 1.

Forcible Energy.name: Forcible Energy
Forcible Energy.description:
You perform complex manipulations to make the energy from your spells so powerful that your enemies remain vulnerable to it afterward.

If your next action is to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that deals acid, electricity, fire, or sonic damage, you can select one target that was damaged to gain weakness 5 to that damage type until the end of your next turn. If a spell deals multiple types of energy damage, choose one that the target gains weakness to.

This has no effect on creatures with resistance or immunity to the energy type you choose.

Repurposed Parts.name: Repurposed Parts
Repurposed Parts.description: You are familiar with the fittings and cogwheels of your snares and can repurpose parts from prepared quick-deploy snares to assemble a new creation on the fly. Using two of the snares you prepared for quick deployment during daily preparations, you can quickly deploy a different snare that you know how to Craft, even if you didn't prepare that snare during your daily preparations.

Homeward Bound.name: Homeward Bound
Homeward Bound.description:
Frequency twice per week

The connection between you and the First World resonates within your body stronger than it does for most gnomes, allowing you to cross the threshold between the Material Plane and the First World.

You gain @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Plane Shift} as a primal innate spell. You can cast it twice per week. This can be used only to travel back and forth between the First World and the Material Plane. Due to your body's natural resonance, you can act as the spell focus, and you don't require a tuning fork.

Daemon Magic.name: Daemon Magic
Daemon Magic.description: The magic of Abaddon runs through your blood, and you can wield that power. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dLdRqT6UxTKlsPgp]{Death Knell} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]{False Life} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

Underwater Volcano.name: Underwater Volcano
Underwater Volcano.description: You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O7ZEqWjwdKyo2CUv]{Volcanic Eruption} as a 7th-level primal innate spell once per day, except that you can only evoke the volcano on the floor of a body of water, and the effects that normally happen to flying creatures happen to swimming creatures instead.

Pied Piping.name: Pied Piping
Pied Piping.description: You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Um0aaJotqMKGmAlR]{Pied Piping} composition spell, which enables you to control the actions of weak-minded individuals.

Metabolize Element.name: Metabolize Element
Metabolize Element.description:
Trigger You take damage from a foe's spell or magical ability with the air, earth, fire, or water trait.

You rapidly metabolize the elemental particles in your opponent's spell to gain a boost of energy. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of your next turn. You can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

Gunslinger Dedication.name: Gunslinger Dedication
Gunslinger Dedication.description:
You become trained in simple and martial crossbows and simple and martial firearms. You become trained in gunslinger class DC. Choose a gunslinger way. You become trained in your way's associated skill; if you were already trained in this skill, you become trained in a skill of your choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of way.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the gunslinger archetype.

Explosive Leap.name: Explosive Leap
Explosive Leap.description:
You aim an explosion from your innovation downward to launch yourself into the air. You jump up to 30 feet in any direction without touching the ground. You must land on a space of solid ground, or else you fall after using your next action. As normal for effects where you fall after using your next action, you still fall at the end of your turn, even if you don't use any further actions that turn.

Special If your innovation is a minion, it can take this action rather than you.

Wholeness of Body.name: Wholeness of Body
Wholeness of Body.description: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qJZZdYBdNaWRJFER]{Wholeness of Body} ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Advanced Seeker of Truths.name: Advanced Seeker of Truths
Advanced Seeker of Truths.description:
You have unlocked deeper secrets to uncovering and hoarding lore. You gain an advanced domain spell from one domain you selected with Seeker of Truths. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Special You can take this feat up to three times, each time selecting a different advanced domain spell from a domain you selected with Seeker of Truths.

Showstopper.name: Showstopper
Showstopper.description: Your twirling weapons create a grand distraction that's difficult to look away from. When using Pistol Twirl to Feint, you can target all enemies within your weapon's first range increment who you can perceive and who can see you. You roll one Deception check and compare it against each target's Perception DC.

Push It.name: Push It
Push It.description: You can push your vehicle's performance beyond the limits envisioned by its makers. Whenever you succeed at a piloting check, the vehicle you are piloting gains a +5-foot circumstance bonus to all its Speeds until the end of your turn. If you critically succeed, this bonus increases to +10 feet.

Makeshift Strike.name: Makeshift Strike
Makeshift Strike.description:
You quickly snatch up whatever's nearby and then attack with it as an improvised weapon.

You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to pick up a nearby object you could use as an improvised weapon. It must be located at around your chest level, such as a mug on a table, rather than an object on the floor. You then either @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} or make an @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.FSxugo3zTgRhW7Og]{Improvised Pummel} with the improvised weapon.

Strong Swimmer.name: Strong Swimmer
Strong Swimmer.description: Your swim Speed increases to match your land Speed.

Bloodline Breadth.name: Bloodline Breadth
Bloodline Breadth.description: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more spells of your bloodline's tradition each day. Increase the number of spells in your repertoire and number of spell slots you gain from sorcerer archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest spell slots.

Adroit Manipulation.name: Adroit Manipulation
Adroit Manipulation.description:
Access Mihrini ethnicity

You've fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith's puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Thievery (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in Thievery). If you roll a success on a Thievery check to Pick a Lock, you get a critical success instead.

Eagle Eyes.name: Eagle Eyes
Eagle Eyes.description: You and your spotter are adept at watching out for one another. As long as you can see or hear each other, neither of you is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or to creatures of your level or lower using a surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

Assisting Shot.name: Assisting Shot
Assisting Shot.description:
Requirements You are wielding a ranged weapon.

With a quick shot, you interfere with a foe in combat. Make a Strike with a ranged weapon. If the Strike hits, the next creature other than you to attack the same target before the start of your next turn gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their roll, or a +2 circumstance bonus if your Strike was a critical hit.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.zcJii1XyOne9EvMr]{Effect: Assisting Shot}

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.AAgoUuwMvHzqNhIN]{Effect: Assisting Shot (Critical Hit)}

Sky and Heaven Stance.name: Sky and Heaven Stance
Sky and Heaven Stance.description:
Requirements You are unarmored

You enter a stance perfected by past champions of the Challenge of Sky and Heaven, allowing you to make jagged strikes like flashes of lightning through the sky. The only Strikes you can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These unarmed attacks deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits.

While in Sky and Heaven Stance, you gain resistance 2 to electricity and resistance 2 to sonic damage. These resistances increase to 5 at 12th level and to 8 at 18th level.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.CQfkyJkRHw4IHWhv]{Stance: Sky and Heaven Stance}

Calculated Splash.name: Calculated Splash
Calculated Splash.description: You have calculated all the angles to maximize a bomb's splash. When you throw an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, you can cause the bomb to deal splash damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 0) instead of the normal amount.

Signature Spell Expansion.name: Signature Spell Expansion
Signature Spell Expansion.description: Your innate connection to magic lets you cast more spells with greater freedom. You gain two additional signature spells, each of which must have a minimum level of 3rd or lower.

Propeller Attachment.name: Propeller Attachment
Propeller Attachment.description: You've mastered attaching clockwork propellers to your daily quick-deploy snares that use gears. This allows you to place your snares in the air or underwater, where they remain in place for up to 10 minutes, after which the propeller runs out of power and they fall or sink. Unless you use additional precautions to hide it, a propeller snare's location is usually obvious.

Tenacious Blood Magic.name: Tenacious Blood Magic
Tenacious Blood Magic.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger You apply an effect from your blood magic that lasts for 1 round.

You have learned how to invest magic more deeply by witnessing Aroden's works. The triggering blood magic effect lasts for 1 minute instead of 1 round.

Superior Sight.name: Superior Sight
Superior Sight.description:
Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. If you already have low-light vision, gain darkvision instead. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.

Note: this version of the feat does not modify vision. See @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.YbneCzvDEr76mrsS]{Superior Sight (Darkvision)} or @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.banx3uX4JjjcHEc8]{Superior Sight (Low-Light Vision)} if you need the feature to also grant you a new sense.

Firearm Expert.name: Firearm Expert
Firearm Expert.description: You've become an expert with your chosen weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple and martial crossbows and simple and martial firearms increase to expert.

Storm Born.name: Storm Born
Storm Born.description: You are at home out in the elements, reveling in the power of nature unleashed. You do not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and your targeted spells don't require a flat check to succeed against a target concealed by weather (such as fog).

Flexible Halcyon Spellcasting.name: Flexible Halcyon Spellcasting
Flexible Halcyon Spellcasting.description: You broaden your ability to channel your power into halcyon magic. You gain one more common halcyon spell of each level of halcyon spell you can cast other than your highest (you do not gain an additional cantrip). You also gain one additional halcyon spell slot for each level of halcyon spell you can cast, other than the highest.

Stonegate.name: Stonegate
Stonegate.description: Earthen barriers no longer impede your progress. You gain @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall} as a 7th-level divine innate spell that you can cast once per day. Unlike the spell, however, this ability can be used only to open passages through barriers of earth or stone.

Expert Scroll Cache.name: Expert Scroll Cache
Expert Scroll Cache.description:
Your scroll collection is more powerful.

In addition to your daily scrolls from Basic Scroll Cache, add a scroll with a 3rd-level spell. At 14th level, add a scroll with a 4th-level spell. At 16th level, add a scroll with a 5th-level spell.

Voice of Authority.name: Voice of Authority
Voice of Authority.description:
You easily command the attention of others, and when the time comes to turn threats into action, your authoritative voice causes foes to falter.

Your voice be heard easily by any creatures within 300 feet if you wish, regardless of the level of ambient noise, although your voice can't penetrate @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} or similar effect. If you roll Intimidation for initiative, on the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to you.

Dragon Spit.name: Dragon Spit
Dragon Spit.description: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true-you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage. Choose one of the following cantrips: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gISYsBFby1TiXfBt]{Acid Splash}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kBhaPuzLUSwS6vVf]{Electric Arc}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}. You can cast this spell as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

Boaster's Challenge.name: Boaster's Challenge
Boaster's Challenge.description: You call out a foe, causing them to become flustered and easier to defeat. Select one creature you can see and declare a challenge. For your challenge, attempt a Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation check against that creature's Will DC. Your challenge must include a linguistic, auditory, or visual component and gains the corresponding trait. If you succeed, you gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls with your weapon or unarmed Strikes against that foe until the end of your next turn; if you have master proficiency in the skill you used, you gain a +4 status bonus instead, and if you're legendary, you gain a +6 status bonus. On a critical success, the status bonus lasts for 3 rounds instead. Whether you succeed or fail, creatures who witnessed your challenge gain a +4 circumstance bonus to their Will DCs against your attempts to challenge for 1 minute.

Red Mantis Assassin Dedication.name: Red Mantis Assassin Dedication
Red Mantis Assassin Dedication.description:
Access You are from Mediogalti Island.

You have learned how to stalk your foes and slay them with a sawtooth sabre. You become trained in Stealth and Assassin Lore; if you were already trained, you become an expert instead. Whenever your proficiency in any weapon increases to expert or beyond, you also gain that new proficiency with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.wkzxLpSe7LN6c5Ld]{Sawtooth Saber}.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Red Mantis assassin archetype.

Fledgling Flight.name: Fledgling Flight
Fledgling Flight.description:
Frequency once per round

You can fly through the air in short bursts at half your land Speed. If you don't end your movement on solid ground, you fall at the end of your turn.

Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to you.

You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position. You Step.

Sacred Ki.name: Sacred Ki
Sacred Ki.description:
The power of your faith suffuses your ki. When you select this feat, choose chaos, evil, good, or law. Your choice must match one of your deity's alignment components.

When you cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ZL8NTvB22NeEWhVG]{Ki Strike} focus spell and damage a creature whose alignment is opposite your chosen alignment, you can choose for the ki strike damage to be of the chosen type.

Additionally, you can substitute the damage from @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.oo7YcRC2gcez81PV]{Ki Blast} (or other ki spells that deal force damage, at the GM's discretion) with damage of your chosen alignment.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.joCQGq27FylDuY9P]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike (Chaotic)}

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.4U9BWv0rSpGbU0wr]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike (Evil)}

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.OplbQWW6i1NtMq9f]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike (Good)}

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.X2BGmuKdGVj4YYyp]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike (Lawful)}

Fleet.name: Fleet
Fleet.description:
You move more quickly on foot. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +5 untyped bonus to land speed

Inescapable Grasp.name: Inescapable Grasp
Inescapable Grasp.description: Your grasp has a supernatural quality to it, preventing your foes from easily escaping-with or without magical assistance. If a creature you have @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} attempts to use a teleportation spell or effect, it must succeed at a Flat Check or the spell fails. If a creature you have grabbed attempts to Escape while under the effect of freedom of movement, it must succeed at a Flat Check or be forced to roll the Escape attempt normally, rather than automatically succeeding.

Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer.name: Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer
Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer.description: You can use the unusual resonance of your wayfinder to grant it additional effects. Choose one cantrip from the arcane, divine, occult, or primal list. You can activate your wayfinder to cast that cantrip at will. As normal, this cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. Additionally, you can Activate your wayfinder with a Single Action (envision) activation to transform it into a nondescript pin or brooch to hide your affiliation with the Pathfinder Society. This transformation lasts for 1 hour.

Zephyr Guard Dedication.name: Zephyr Guard Dedication
Zephyr Guard Dedication.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.Lr108TWazbuxxUzP]{Zephyr Guard}

As a Zephyr Guard, you're always vigilant against crime and threats to the city's safety. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against attempts to Palm an Object, Steal, or Conceal an Object (including you're Seeking concealed objects). You become trained in Society and Katapesh Lore; if you were already trained, you become an expert instead.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Zephyr Guard archetype.

Disruptive Blur.name: Disruptive Blur
Disruptive Blur.description: You use cacophonous blasts from your gun or distracting shots from your crossbow to cause momentary diversions, letting you move about the battlefield with impunity. After you make a Strike with a firearm or crossbow, creatures can't take reactions that would be triggered by your movement for the rest of your turn.

Wings Of The Dragon.name: Wings Of The Dragon
Wings Of The Dragon.description: You can manifest draconic wings to soar through the air at great speed. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HWJODX2zPg5cg34F]{Dragon Wings} sorcerer bloodline spell and a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. If you already have a focus pool, increase your number of Focus Points by 1.

Confounding Image.name: Confounding Image
Confounding Image.description: When you cast mirror image, you can modify its duration to be sustained up to 1 minute and modify its range to 30 feet. If you do, replace the spell's standard effects with the following: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself that appears in an unoccupied square within range. The image takes up space and has a reach of 5 feet, and your allies can flank with the image. It doesn't have any other attributes a creature would normally have other than an AC equal to your spell DC and saving throw modifiers equal to your spell DC - 10. If the image is hit by an attack or fails a save, or if you ever move more than 30 feet from it, the spell ends. Creatures can move through its space without hindrance. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the image to an unoccupied square within range.

Blessed Spell.name: Blessed Spell
Blessed Spell.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

When you focus your magic on an ally, you can remove harmful conditions.

If your next action is to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} from a spell slot, and that spell targets only a single ally, you can also attempt to remove a harmful condition from that ally. The condition must be one that could be removed by your Mercy feat, including those granted by later feats such as @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.kZdcoaTD849QalR9]{Greater Mercy}.

Attempt a counteract check based on the spell's DC and level. This effect is in addition to the normal effects of your spell.

Cascade Bearer's Spellcasting.name: Cascade Bearer's Spellcasting
Cascade Bearer's Spellcasting.description: Your Cascade Bearer training allows you to broaden the horizons of your halcyon spells further than most Magaambyans, weaving in spiritual magic. You can select halcyon spells from the divine or occult spell lists in additional to the arcane or primal spell lists, though they are still halcyon spells (so you choose when casting if they are arcane or primal spells). You gain a halcyon cantrip and a halcyon 1st-level spell.

Lastwall Warden.name: Lastwall Warden
Lastwall Warden.description:
You use your shield to protect your allies, not just yourself, especially against the undead. When you have a shield raised, you can use your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you, in addition to its usual trigger. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of you, following the normal rules for a Shield Block.

If an undead makes an attack against an ally within 10 feet, you can Step to become adjacent to your ally and then use Shield Block as part of the same reaction.

Aasimar's Mercy.name: Aasimar's Mercy
Aasimar's Mercy.description:
Your celestial powers allow you to remove lesser afflictions with ease.

Each day, you can cast two 4th-level divine innate spells. You can choose from the following spells each time you cast: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OyFCwQuw8XRazsNr]{Remove Curse}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.RneiyehRO6f7LP44]{Remove Disease}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Neutralize Poison}.

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger You critically succeed at a Strike or Disarm with your Aldori dueling sword.

Your incredible skill with your blade unnerves your foes. You attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of your Strike or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor do you take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand your language.

Friendly Toss.name: Friendly Toss
Friendly Toss.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to an ally and have one or

more hands free.

You toss your friends around the battlefield. Pick up an adjacent ally of your size or smaller and throw them to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. Their movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Your ally ends this movement on their feet and doesn't take damage from the fall. If your ally ends this movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} against an enemy within their reach as a reaction.

Celestial Form.name: Celestial Form
Celestial Form.description:
You take on a celestial countenance, appearing like a type of celestial who serves your deity; for example, as an angel, you would gain a halo and feathery wings.

You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed. You gain @Compendium[pf2e.ancestryfeatures.HHVQDp61ehcpdiU8]{Darkvision} if you don't already have it, and you gain the celestial trait and the trait appropriate to the type of servitor you've become (archon, angel, or azata, for example).

Tiger Stance.name: Tiger Stance
Tiger Stance.description:
Requirements You are unarmored

You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

On a critical success with your tiger claws, if you deal damage, the target takes [[/r 1d4 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

As long as your Speed is at least 20 feet while in Tiger Stance, you can Step 10 feet.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.pf9yvKNg6jZLrE30]{Stance: Tiger Stance}

Evasiveness (Rogue).name: Evasiveness (Rogue)
Evasiveness (Rogue).description: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.

Ratspeak.name: Ratspeak
Ratspeak.description:
To you, the squeaking of rats and other rodents makes a strange kind of sense.

You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with rodents, including beavers, mice, porcupines, rats, and squirrels, but not with other mammals, such as dogs or bats. The GM determines which animals count as rodents.

Steam Spell.name: Steam Spell
Steam Spell.description: You transform your fire spells into steam, making them more effective underwater. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with the fire trait, you can cast it underwater. When you do so, it takes the form of scalding steam. Underwater creatures do not gain the normal fire resistance for being underwater against this spell, but they don't light things on fire or cause @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, nor do they add other effects that would apply to fire but not steam (at the GM's discretion).

Ricochet Feint.name: Ricochet Feint
Ricochet Feint.description: While in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.RsNvCSrCN7czHC0G]{Ricochet Stance}, you can bounce a thrown weapon off a foe to distract them. You can attempt a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against a creature within the first range increment of a thrown weapon you are wielding, rather than only creatures within your melee reach.

Provocator Dedication.name: Provocator Dedication
Provocator Dedication.description:
Access Successfully defeat the eberarks in the Irorium.

For you, fighting is as much about style as skill. You become trained in simple weapons, martial weapons, and one advanced weapon of your choice. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using your chosen advanced weapon, you also apply the critical specialization of that weapon. You become an expert in Performance and your choice of either Acrobatics or Athletics. If you were an expert in all three of these skills, you instead become an expert in a skill of your choice.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the provocator archetype.

Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart.name: Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart
Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart.description: You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ZAX0OOcKtYMQlquR]{Symphony of the Unfettered Heart} composition spell, which enables you to protect an ally against incapacitating conditions.

Loyal Empath.name: Loyal Empath
Loyal Empath.description: You have incredible empathy for your friends and family, and you have an innate timing for helping others in distress. You can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} reaction to grant a bonus to another creature's Will saving throw. As usual for Aid, you need to prepare by using an action on your turn to encourage the creature to bravely withstand the effect.

Terrain Master.name: Terrain Master
Terrain Master.description: You adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain. You can spend 1 hour practicing in your current terrain in order to make it your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain}, replacing your current favored terrain temporarily. If you spend a full day out of the new favored terrain, your favored terrain reverts back to your original choice when you took the Favored Terrain feat.

Flexible Tail.name: Flexible Tail
Flexible Tail.description: You can perform simple Interact actions with your tail, such as opening an unlocked door. Your tail can't perform actions that require fingers or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, and you can't use it to hold items.

Wild Strider.name: Wild Strider
Wild Strider.description: Natural obstacles pose no obstacle to you. You gain the ranger's @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy]{Wild Stride} class feature. This allows you to ignore the effects of all non-magical difficult terrain, treat greater difficult terrain as merely difficult terrain, and gives you an additional benefit from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain} based on the terrain.

Kobold Weapon Innovator.name: Kobold Weapon Innovator
Kobold Weapon Innovator.description: You've learned devious tactics with your kobold weapons. Whenever you critically hit with a crossbow, greatpick, light pick, pick, spear, or kobold weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

Treacherous Earth.name: Treacherous Earth
Treacherous Earth.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

You have the power to shatter the earth into a shape of your devising. You crack the ground beneath you, creating difficult terrain in a 5-foot burst centered on one corner of your space.

Ancestral Weaponry.name: Ancestral Weaponry
Ancestral Weaponry.description: You blend monastic techniques with the ancestral fighting styles of your people. Choose an ancestry for which you have access to all weapons with that trait. For you, melee weapons with that ancestry trait and either the agile or finesse trait gain the monk trait.

Ceremony of Protection.name: Ceremony of Protection
Ceremony of Protection.description:
You manipulate your exoskeleton to overlap itself. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.9kNbiZPOM2wy60ao]{Effect: Ceremony of Protection}

Invulnerable Juggernaut.name: Invulnerable Juggernaut
Invulnerable Juggernaut.description:
You are unstoppable, able to shrug off mortal wounds with ease. You gain resistance equal to 3 + your Constitution modifier to all damage, and your resistance from raging resistance increases to 8 + your Constitution modifier.

In addition, if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can end your rage as a reaction to stay at 1 Hit Point. If you do, you become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 2} (or increase your wounded condition by 2 if you are already wounded).

Loremaster's Etude.name: Loremaster's Etude
Loremaster's Etude.description: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall. You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5Pc55FGGqVpIAJ62]{Loremaster's Etude} composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Halfling Lore.name: Halfling Lore
Halfling Lore.description: You've dutifully learned how to keep your balance and how to stick to the shadows where it's safe, important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Halfling Lore.

Esoteric Oath (Liberator).name: Esoteric Oath (Liberator)
Esoteric Oath (Liberator).description:
You've sworn an oath to slay the alien abominations that lurk in the remote corners of Golarion. Add the following tenet to your champion's code, after the other tenets. "You must slay evil aberrations you encounter as long as you have a reasonable chance of success."

If you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IX1VlVCL5sFTptEE]{Liberating Step} triggered by an evil aberration, your ally gains a +4 circumstance bonus to checks granted by your Liberating Step, and the ally can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step} twice afterward.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.tAsFXMzNkpj964X4]{Effect: Liberating Step (vs. Aberration)}

You don't consider evil aberrations to be legitimate authorities, even in nations they rule.

Skull Creeper.name: Skull Creeper
Skull Creeper.description: You wear skulls to demoralize foes. You become trained in Intimidation and gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.xQMz6eDgX75WX2ce]{Intimidating Glare} skill feat. If you're already trained in Intimidation, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. If you pay 50 gp for a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.HYnwTFuLsFSsUAMG]{Splendid Skull Mask}, the mask grants you a +1 item bonus to Intimidation; its usage is worn (mask).

Reactive Pursuit.name: Reactive Pursuit
Reactive Pursuit.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe moves away from you, and you can reach at least one space adjacent to the foe with a Stride action

You keep pace with a retreating foe. You Stride, but you must end your movement adjacent to the triggering enemy. Your move does not trigger reactions from the triggering enemy. You can use Reactive Pursuit to Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Stride if you have the corresponding movement type.

Two-Weapon Fusillade.name: Two-Weapon Fusillade
Two-Weapon Fusillade.description:
Requirements You're wielding two weapons, each in a different hand. At least one of these weapons must be a loaded firearm or loaded crossbow.

You attack with both your weapons in a furious barrage. Strike twice, once with each weapon.

Unbalancing Finisher.name: Unbalancing Finisher
Unbalancing Finisher.description: You attack with a flashy assault that leaves your target off balance. Make a melee Strike. If you hit and deal damage, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the end of your next turn.

Webslinger.name: Webslinger
Webslinger.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Your natural ability to create silken webs blends with your magical powers, allowing you to create impossibly large webs with great frequency. This has the effects of a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9s5tqqXNzcoKamWx]{Web} spell using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

Far Throw.name: Far Throw
Far Throw.description: When you Strike with a thrown weapon, you take only a -1 penalty for each additional range increment between you and the target, rather than a -2 penalty.

Elemental Embellish.name: Elemental Embellish
Elemental Embellish.description: You can summon a harmless but impressive elemental display. You become trained in Intimidation. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. When you Demoralize a foe, if you choose to Demoralize via an elemental display, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty when you attempt to Demoralize a creature that doesn't understand your language.

Second Ally.name: Second Ally
Second Ally.description: Your inner grace attracts the attention of a second protective spirit. Choose a second type of divine ally and gain its benefits.

Animal Senses (Low-Light Vision).name: Animal Senses (Low-Light Vision)
Animal Senses (Low-Light Vision).description:
You gain one of the following senses available to your inherent animal: @Compendium[pf2e.ancestryfeatures.HHVQDp61ehcpdiU8]{Darkvision}, @Compendium[pf2e.ancestryfeatures.DRtaqOHXTRtGRIUT]{Low-Light Vision}, or scent (imprecise) 30 feet. You must have low-light vision before you can gain darkvision with this feat.

If your inherent animal doesn't typically have a specific type of sense, you can't gain that sense with this feat.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

Wild Shape.name: Wild Shape
Wild Shape.description: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8RWfKConLYFZpQ9X]{Wild Shape} order spell, which lets you transform into a variety of forms that you can expand with druid feats.

Cavalier's Charge.name: Cavalier's Charge
Cavalier's Charge.description:
Requirements You are riding your mount.

You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} to order your mount to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} twice. At any point during this movement, you can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} one enemy within reach or within the first range increment of a ranged weapon. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll.

Razor Claws.name: Razor Claws
Razor Claws.description: Your have honed your claws to be deadly. Your claw attack deals [[/r {1d6}[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage} instead of 1d4 and gains the versatile (piercing) trait.

Improvisational Warrior.name: Improvisational Warrior
Improvisational Warrior.description: When you use an improvised weapon, you apply the critical specialization of a brawling weapon to it. Depending on the shape and nature of the improvised weapon, your GM might determine another weapon group's critical specialization is more appropriate.

Favor Of Heaven.name: Favor Of Heaven
Favor Of Heaven.description: You're one of Hei Feng's chosen people and have the authority of the Celestial Court on your side. Once per day, you can cast a 6th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} as a divine innate spell. In addition, you gain resistance 5 to both good and evil damage.

Razzle-Dazzle.name: Razzle-Dazzle
Razzle-Dazzle.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blind} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzle} a creature.

You've spent considerable time practicing the manipulation of light, weaponizing your blade's reflection or bolstering the luminosity of magical displays to unconventional heights.

Extend the duration of the blinded or dazzled condition you give the target by 1 round.

Brawling Focus.name: Brawling Focus
Brawling Focus.description: You know how to make the most of your attacks when fighting hand-to-hand. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of unarmed strikes in the brawling group and weapons in the brawling group. If you have Monastic Weaponry, you also gain the critical specialization effects of all monk weapons in which you are trained.

Alacritous Action.name: Alacritous Action
Alacritous Action.description: Your eidolon moves more quickly. It gains a +10-foot status bonus to its Speed.

Legendary Monster Hunter.name: Legendary Monster Hunter
Legendary Monster Hunter.description:
Your knowledge of monsters is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your prey. Your bonus from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.YTTJqRKH8QZl6al2]{Monster Hunter} (and the bonus from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.2yq3l8e2Vzz34yRV]{Monster Warden} if you have it) increases from +1 to +2 for you and any allies who benefit.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.LB0PTV5yqMlBmRFj]{Effect: Legendary Monster Hunter}

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.aUpcWqaLBlmpnJgW]{Effect: Legendary Monster Warden}

Legendary Guide.name: Legendary Guide
Legendary Guide.description:
You know the wilderness so well that you can help your party travel through it with ease.

When you are setting the path for your party through wilderness terrain, your party gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed for the purpose of calculating the party's travel speed, your party's travel speed doesn't decrease in difficult terrain, and greater difficult terrain halves your party's travel speed instead of reducing it to a third.

This doesn't increase your party's Speed during an encounter or allow your party to ignore difficult terrain during an encounter.

Pervasive Superstition.name: Pervasive Superstition
Pervasive Superstition.description: You steep yourself in superstition and practice ancient orc mental exercises for shrugging off the effects of magic. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells and magical effects at all times.

First Revelation (Cosmos Mystery).name: First Revelation (Cosmos Mystery)
First Revelation (Cosmos Mystery).description:
You gain your mystery's initial revelation spell (@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.mlNYROcFrUF8nFgk]{Spray of Stars}). Casting this spell progresses your @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.ibX2EhKkyUtbOHLj]{Oracular Curse}. Use the minor curse from your mystery, but when you progress it again, instead of your mystery's moderate curse effect, you become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} in addition to the effects of the minor curse.

If you don't have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OSefkMgojBLqmRDh]{Refocus} by reconciling the conflicting nature of your mystery, which also reduces your curse to minor.

Minor Curse of Cosmos

Your unnatural lightness makes it hard to keep your footing and interact with other physical objects. You are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and take a -2 penalty to saves and DCs against @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, and other forms of forced movement.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.usi1qa95gK4WnFIg]{Effect: Minor Cosmos Curse}

Scouring Rage.name: Scouring Rage
Scouring Rage.description:
Trigger You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Ah5g9pDwWF9b9VW9]{Rage}.

You emit a powerful surge of instinctual energy when you unleash your potential. Each adjacent creature takes damage equal to your level (basic Fortitude save against your class DC) of the same type as your additional damage during that Rage.

Unshakable Idealism.name: Unshakable Idealism
Unshakable Idealism.description: Your faith and hope can't be shaken, and you won't flee when lives are at stake. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saves against fear effects and emotion effects that inflict despair. When you would gain the fleeing condition, you can choose to stand your ground and be stunned for the effect's duration as well, preventing you from running and allowing you to re-enter the fight more quickly when the effect ends.

Expert Poisoner.name: Expert Poisoner
Expert Poisoner.description: Your @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Pe0zmIqyTBc2Td0I]{Advanced Alchemy} level for poison increases to your level –3.

Shield of Reckoning.name: Shield of Reckoning
Shield of Reckoning.description:
Trigger A foe's attack against an ally matches the trigger for both your Shield Block reaction and your champion's reaction

When you shield your ally against an attack, you call upon your power to protect your ally further. You use the Shield Block reaction to prevent damage to an ally and also use your champion's reaction against the foe that attacked your ally.

Cynical.name: Cynical
Cynical.description: You've been approached with suspicion and distrust throughout your life and return these sentiments back to the strangers you encounter. As a result, you are difficult to deceive. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Perception DC against Lies and Impersonations.

Purifying Spell.name: Purifying Spell
Purifying Spell.description: You purify the water within a creature's body to cleanse them of illness. If the next action you use is to cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} targeting a single living creature, you can attempt to counteract a disease or poison affecting the target, in addition to the other benefits of heal. If you do, heal gains the water trait.

Impossible Volley (Ranger).name: Impossible Volley (Ranger)
Impossible Volley (Ranger).description:
Requirements You are wielding a ranged weapon with the volley trait and reload 0

You fire a volley at all foes in an area. Make one Strike with a -2 penalty against each enemy within a 10-foot-radius burst centered at or beyond your weapon's volley range. Roll the damage only once for all targets.

Giant's Stature.name: Giant's Stature
Giant's Stature.description:
Requirements You are Medium or smaller.

You grow to incredible size. You become Large, increasing your reach by 5 feet and gaining the clumsy 1 condition until you stop raging. Your equipment grows with you.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.6VrKQ0PhRXuteusQ]{Effect: Giant's Stature}

Rat Familiar.name: Rat Familiar
Rat Familiar.description: You have a pet rat that has become magically bonded to you. You gain a familiar, and this familiar must be a rat. It still gets the benefits of familiar abilities, but its base form remains a rat.

Fire Savvy.name: Fire Savvy
Fire Savvy.description:
Access You are from Dongun Hold or Alkenstar.

You've grown up around a forge and are well-suited to dealing with smoke and flame. Your flat check to remove persistent fire damage is DC 10 instead of DC 15, which is reduced to DC 5 with appropriate assistance. In addition, if you roll a success on a saving throw against suffocation or choking due to smoke or ash, you get a critical success instead.

Assurance.name: Assurance
Assurance.description:
Even in the worst circumstances, you can perform basic tasks. Choose a skill you're trained in. You can forgo rolling a skill check for that skill to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, choose a different skill and gain the benefits for that skill.

Disengaging Twist.name: Disengaging Twist
Disengaging Twist.description:
Trigger A creature gives you the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition.

Your ability to twist your opponents' bodies into painful locks and holds makes you particularly adept at escaping such predicaments. Attempt an Athletics check to Escape the triggering condition. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.

Eagle Eye.name: Eagle Eye
Eagle Eye.description: Your practice with crossbows and firearms has sharpened your attention to detail. You become a master in Perception.

Hunter's Vision.name: Hunter's Vision
Hunter's Vision.description: You are so focused on your hunted prey that you can see it clearly even beyond the limits of your senses. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tj86Rnq3QuQnDtG3]{Hunter's Vision} warden spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Synergistic Spell.name: Synergistic Spell
Synergistic Spell.description: You combine your synergy and spells into a fantastic web of magic, allowing you to cast two spells at once. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from one of your halcyon spell slots, after that spell resolves, you can Cast another Spell as a free action. This spell must be cast from one of your halcyon spell slots and be a spell that would normally take two actions to cast.

Split Slot.name: Split Slot
Split Slot.description:
You can prepare two spells in one slot, giving you the freedom to choose the spell when you cast it.

When you prepare your spells for the day, you can choose one spell slot at least 1 level lower than the highest-level spell you can cast and prepare two spells in that slot.

When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} from that slot, choose which spell to cast. Once you've chosen, the unused spell dissipates as though you hadn't prepared it at all-for example, it isn't available for use with @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.v82XtjAVN4ffgVVR]{Drain Bonded Item}.

Claws Of The Dragon (Draconic Bloodline).name: Claws Of The Dragon (Draconic Bloodline)
Claws Of The Dragon (Draconic Bloodline).description:
Your fingernails grow into razor-sharp claws, and scales speckle your fingers, hands, and wrists. Your claws are agile, finesse unarmed attacks that deal [[/r {1d6}[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage} and are in the brawling weapon group.

When you cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.K8vvrOgW4bGakXxm]{Dragon Claws} spell, increase the slashing damage die from d4 to d6 and increase the resistance to 10 at 1st level, 15 at 5th level, and 20 at 9th level.

Natural Medicine.name: Natural Medicine
Natural Medicine.description: You can apply natural cures to heal your allies. You can use Nature instead of Medicine to Treat Wounds.
