You can use this ability to specify your snares to trigger on creatures that typically do not trigger snares, such as creatures smaller than Small, though the creature must still otherwise satisfy the snare's trigger as normal.

Hatchling Flight.name: Hatchling Flight
Hatchling Flight.description:
Frequency once per round

You can fly a little! You Fly up to half your Speed. If you don't end your movement on solid ground, you fall at the end of your turn.

Conrasu Lore.name: Conrasu Lore
Conrasu Lore.description:
You have learned about your history and your people from shapers. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Crafting and Occultism. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Conrasu Lore.

Note: If you are already trained in the skill provided by this feat, you need to manually select an alternative skill. You also need to manually enter the granted Lore skill.

Nimble Elf.name: Nimble Elf
Nimble Elf.description: Your muscles are tightly honed. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Shadow of the Wilds.name: Shadow of the Wilds
Shadow of the Wilds.description: It's difficult to notice your passage through wild areas. As long as you're not in an urban environment, you're always considered to be @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Covering Tracks}, even if you chose a different activity in exploration mode.

Advanced Weaponry.name: Advanced Weaponry
Advanced Weaponry.description:
Your eidolon's attack evolves.

Choose one of your eidolon's starting melee unarmed attacks. It gains one of the following traits, chosen when you gain the feat: disarm, grapple, nonlethal, shove, trip, or versatile bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

Gecko's Grip.name: Gecko's Grip
Gecko's Grip.description: You stick to walls with a preternatural grip. You gain a climb Speed of 15 feet.

Kreighton's Cognitive Crossover.name: Kreighton's Cognitive Crossover
Kreighton's Cognitive Crossover.description:
Trigger You gain no information from a Recall Knowledge check (usually because you failed the secret check) using one of the two skills you chose for this feat.

Kreighton teaches his students that an agile mind can glean clues leading to the truth, even from the most unlikely of sources. You immediately reattempt the triggering check using the other chosen skill.

Special When you gain this feat, choose two of the following skills: Arcana, Crafting, Lore (any one), Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Religion, or Society.

Nocturnal Charm.name: Nocturnal Charm
Nocturnal Charm.description: The supernatural charm of your vampiric progenitor hangs about you, and you've learned to use it on mortals. Against humanoids (or other creatures of your type, if you're not a humanoid), you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to Lie, and to Diplomacy checks to Gather Information and Make an Impression.

Metamagic Mastery.name: Metamagic Mastery
Metamagic Mastery.description: Altering your spells doesn't take any longer than casting them normally. You can use metamagic single actions as free actions.

Blessed Denial.name: Blessed Denial
Blessed Denial.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet would become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}.

You exude peace and protection, lessening a harmful condition as it falls upon an ally. Reduce the value of the condition your ally would take by 1 (to a minimum of 0). If the ally takes more than one condition at the same time, choose one to reduce.

Eternal Blessing.name: Eternal Blessing
Eternal Blessing.description: Your good deeds have brought your deity's grace to you for all of eternity. You're continuously surrounded by a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XSujb7EsSwKl19Uu]{Bless} spell with a spell level equal to half your level (rounded up). The radius is 15 feet, and you can't increase it. You can Dismiss the spell; if you do, it returns automatically after 1 minute.

Master Summoning Spellcasting.name: Master Summoning Spellcasting
Master Summoning Spellcasting.description: You gain the master bounded spellcasting benefits.

Constant Gaze.name: Constant Gaze
Constant Gaze.description: Your eyes keep a continual watch for dangers from all sides. You can't be flanked by creatures of your level or lower, even when you haven't used Watchful Gaze.

Mirror Shield.name: Mirror Shield
Mirror Shield.description:
Trigger An opponent casting a spell that targets you critically fails a spell attack roll against your AC.

Requirements You have a shield raised

You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent. Make a ranged attack against the triggering creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. If you can cast spells, you can make a spell attack roll instead. If you succeed, your opponent takes the effects of a successful spell attack roll for their own spell (or the effects of a critical success if your attack roll was a critical success).

Work Yourself Up.name: Work Yourself Up
Work Yourself Up.description:
Requirements You have a reaction available and aren't prevented from using @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2424g94rpoiN1IPh]{Catharsis}.

You concentrate on your mental state, tapping into that raw emotional energy. Take your Catharsis reaction, causing the catharsis activation and entering your emotional fervor as normal. The fervor lasts only until the end of your turn. At the end of your emotional fervor, you experience the effects of your emotional fallout, as normal.

Shore Step.name: Shore Step
Shore Step.description:
The shallows and tide pools have always called to you and let you pass unhindered. You ignore difficult terrain resulting from shallow water.

In addition, if you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} on a slippery or wet surface, or on an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, you get a critical success instead.

Twinned Defense (Swashbuckler).name: Twinned Defense (Swashbuckler)
Twinned Defense (Swashbuckler).description:
Requirements You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand

You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you. While you are in this stance, you constantly gain the benefits of the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.Y8LHfkzGyOhPlUou]{Twin Parry} action.

Ritualist Dedication.name: Ritualist Dedication
Ritualist Dedication.description:
You have begun to master the difficult art of casting rituals. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all primary checks to perform a ritual.

You learn two uncommon rituals with a level no higher than half your level; you must meet all prerequisites for casting the ritual to choose it. At 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you learn another uncommon ritual with a level no higher than half your level and for which you meet the prerequisites.

You can cast these as the primary caster, but you can't teach them to anyone else or allow someone else to serve as primary caster unless they know the ritual as well.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the ritualist archetype. If you retrain out of this feat, you lose the rituals learned from it.

Eldritch Debilitations.name: Eldritch Debilitations
Eldritch Debilitations.description:
You know how to apply debilitations that are particularly troublesome for spellcasters. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bp0Up04x3dzGK5bB]{Debilitating Strike}.

  • Debilitation The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.
  • Debilitation The target can't @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step}.

Master Siege Engineer.name: Master Siege Engineer
Master Siege Engineer.description: What you don't know about artillery isn't worth knowing and your mastery allows you to perform an impossible number of actions as part of a siege weapon's crew. You're permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. You can only use the extra action to Aim or Launch a siege weapon.

Stumbling Feint.name: Stumbling Feint
Stumbling Feint.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.7FRYyKXDKjGoANYj]{Stumbling Stance}.

You lash out confusingly with what seems to be a weak move but instead allows you to unleash a dangerous flurry of blows upon your unsuspecting foe.

When you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.nbfNETdpee8CVM17]{Flurry of Blows}, you can attempt a check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} as a free action just before the first Strike.

On a success, instead of making the target @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against your next attack, they become flat-footed against both attacks from the Flurry of Blows.

Greater Mercy.name: Greater Mercy
Greater Mercy.description:
Your faith enhances your ability to remove conditions.

When you use @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.zilwynzk8lIujgZo]{Mercy}, you can instead attempt to counteract the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} conditions.

Fuse Stance.name: Fuse Stance
Fuse Stance.description: You have combined two stances into a single stance all your own. When you take this feat, choose two stances you know and combine them into a single fused stance. Give your new fused stance a unique name. When you enter your fused stance, you gain all the effects of both stances, including the requirements and restrictions. You can't fuse stances with fundamentally incompatible requirements or restrictions (such as @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.ZL5UU9quCTvcWzfY]{Mountain Stance} and @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.bf7NCeKqDClaqhTR]{Crane Stance}, which both require using only one type of Strike).

Cel Rau.name: Cel Rau
Cel Rau.description: You are a cel rau, child of a strigoi, one of the first vampires to walk Golarion. Your heritage ties you to the Shadow Plane and grants you strange resilience to light and darkness alike. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects with the darkness, light, or shadow traits, and whenever you become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for at least 2 rounds, you can reduce the duration by 1 round.

Melodious Spell.name: Melodious Spell
Melodious Spell.description: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance. If the next action you take is to Cast a Spell, attempt a Performance check against all observers' Perception DCs. If your Performance check is successful against an observer's Perception DC, that observer doesn't notice that you are Casting a Spell, even though normally spells have sensory manifestations that would make spellcasting obvious to those around you, and verbal, somatic, and material components are extremely overt. You hide all of these as part of an ordinary performance. This hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish.

Earthsense.name: Earthsense
Earthsense.description: Your connection to earth and stone allows you to feel the slightest displacement that disturbs them, down to the shift of a pebble. You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.

Basic Captivator Spellcasting.name: Basic Captivator Spellcasting
Basic Captivator Spellcasting.description: Your innate ability to fascinate others develops into full-fledged spellcasting. This spellcasting comes naturally and instinctively to you, rather than as a product of training. Choose a 1st-level occult spell from either the enchantment or illusion school. You can Cast this Spell as an occult innate spell. At 6th level, you gain a 2nd-level spell, and at 8th level, you gain a 3rd-level spell. Each of these spells must be from either the enchantment or illusion school.

Protective Bond.name: Protective Bond
Protective Bond.description:
Trigger You and your eidolon are in a damaging effect's area.

The power of your bond can protect you and your eidolon from harm. If you and your eidolon would take different amounts of damage from the area effect, you take the lower amount of damage instead of the greater amount of damage.

Special This feat has the trait matching your eidolon's tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Reflective Ripple Stance.name: Reflective Ripple Stance
Reflective Ripple Stance.description:
Requirements You're unarmored.

You enter a stance of fluid grace as small amounts of water flow with your movements and attacks. You can make flowing wave attacks that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the agile, disarm, finesse, nonlethal, trip, unarmed, and water traits.

While in Reflective Ripple Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC to avoid being Disarmed and Tripped.

Special This feat gains your choice of either the divine or occult trait, matching your ki spell tradition if possible.

Ritual Reversion.name: Ritual Reversion
Ritual Reversion.description: You can temporarily revert to a less conspicuous form without diminishing your senses. You take the form of an ordinary specimen of the type of plant or fungus that most closely resembles you, reverting to your body's appearance just before your spirit joined with it. This otherwise has the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{Tree Shape}, except that your size remains Small.

Hydraulic Deflection.name: Hydraulic Deflection
Hydraulic Deflection.description:
Drawing moisture from the atmosphere, you create a disc of hovering water that deflects attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.IfsglZ7fdegwem0E]{Effect: Hydraulic Deflection}

Combat Reading.name: Combat Reading
Combat Reading.description:
You use a performer's cold reading techniques, aura reading, and other tricks to discover your foe's strengths and weaknesses.

The GM rolls a secret Occultism check for you against the Deception or Stealth DC (whichever is higher) of an enemy of your choice who is engaged in combat and isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from you, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from you, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by you. The GM might apply a penalty for the distance between you and the enemy. The enemy is then temporarily immune to your Combat Reading for 1 day.

Critical Success The GM chooses and tells you two of the following pieces of information about the enemy: which of the enemy's weaknesses is highest, which of the enemy's saving throws has the lowest modifier, one immunity the enemy has, or which of the enemy's resistances is highest. In the event of a tie, the GM should pick one at random.

Success The GM chooses one piece of information from the above list to tell you about the enemy.

Critical Failure The GM gives you false information (the GM makes up the information).

Dream May.name: Dream May
Dream May.description:
You are the child of a night hag, making one of your eyes violet or even black. Your mother's powers over sleep and dreams have given you a degree of resistance to those effects, granting you a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against sleep effects and effects that cause or alter dreams.

In addition, sleep is more restorative for you. You regain [[/r (@details.level.value*2)*(max(@abilities.con.mod,1))]]{HP equal to your Constitution modifier times double your level} instead of just times your level, and you reduce any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} conditions you have by 2 instead of by 1.

True Gaze.name: True Gaze
True Gaze.description:
Frequency once per hour

When you focus your eyes carefully, your gaze can pierce through all obfuscations, even magical ones. When you use True Gaze, you gain the effects of a 6th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{True Seeing} spell, using your Perception modifier for the counteract check.

Uncanny Awareness.name: Uncanny Awareness
Uncanny Awareness.description: You have a keen sense of movement around you. You gain motion sense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet. Motion sense allows you to detect nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Crone's Cruelty.name: Crone's Cruelty
Crone's Cruelty.description: Filled with rancor and hate, you rend the minds of those who displease you. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8kJbiBEjMWG4VUjs]{Warp Mind} once per day as an occult innate spell.

Ranged Combatant (Slashing).name: Ranged Combatant (Slashing)
Ranged Combatant (Slashing).description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 slashing damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

True Transmogrification.name: True Transmogrification
True Transmogrification.description: You transmogrify your eidolon each day. During your daily preparations, you can swap out any number of your evolution feats, each for a different evolution feat of an appropriate level for which you meet the prerequisites. These swaps last until your next daily preparations.

Metamagic Channel.name: Metamagic Channel
Metamagic Channel.description:
Deep understanding of divine revelations into the nature of vital essence allows you to freely manipulate the effects of your positive or negative energy.

Use 1 metamagic action that you can perform that normally takes 1 action and can be applied to the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell. If you use it in this way, its effects apply only to a harm or heal spell.

Swift.name: Swift
Swift.description:
You move with the wind always at your back. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Special The Speed increase from this feat isn't cumulative with any Speed increase from your ancestry feats (such as Nimble Elf).

Aquatic Adaptation.name: Aquatic Adaptation
Aquatic Adaptation.description:
Frequency once per day

If you and up to four other creatures are in contact with a body of water deep enough for you to fully submerge, you can spend 10 minutes adapting the creatures to that specific body of water. This allows them to breathe normally while within that body of water and protects them from deep ocean pressure. These effects last until the creatures are no longer in contact with that body of water or until you use this ability again, whichever comes first for each creature.

Pirate Dedication.name: Pirate Dedication
Pirate Dedication.description:
As a pirate, you sail the seas in search of enemy ships to plunder. You become trained in Sailing Lore, or become an expert in it if you were already trained.

You ignore the effects of difficult terrain or uneven ground caused by a ship's movement. Additionally, you gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.vZltxwRNvF5khf9a]{Boarding Assault} action.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the pirate archetype.

Myriad Forms.name: Myriad Forms
Myriad Forms.description: With a bit of self-discovery, you find a new form. You gain the alternate form of a kitsune heritage other than your own, adding it to the options for your Change Shape.

Step Lively.name: Step Lively
Step Lively.description:
Trigger A Large or larger enemy ends a move action adjacent to you.

You are an expert at avoiding the lumbering footsteps of larger creatures. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step} to another space adjacent to the enemy.

Evade Doom.name: Evade Doom
Evade Doom.description: You can elude supernatural disaster. When you would gain the doomed condition, you can attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, you don't gain the doomed condition.

Hasted Assault.name: Hasted Assault
Hasted Assault.description:
You can speed yourself up to move and attack more swiftly. You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.3MzuRDc7ccylpW2e]{Hasted Assault} conflux spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Nameless Anonymity.name: Nameless Anonymity
Nameless Anonymity.description: Your mask protects you further from divination. Once per day, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} on yourself, heightened to the highest level of spell you can cast; the spell ends immediately if your mask is removed for even a moment. The spell is of the same tradition as your focus spells.

Toppling Dance.name: Toppling Dance
Toppling Dance.description: While sharing a creature's space using Dance Underfoot, your weapons and unarmed attacks gain the trip trait, but only against the creature whose space you share. You can be in the same space as a Large or larger prone creature, even if it's not your ally.

Form Retention.name: Form Retention
Form Retention.description:
You have trained your mind and body to tolerate polymorph magic for longer periods of time, so long as you prepare for the change appropriately.

When preparing a polymorph spell that lasts 1 minute and grants a battle form, you can prepare the spell in a slot 2 levels higher than normal. This doesn't grant any of the normal benefits of heightening a spell, but the spell lasts up to 10 minutes.

For example, if you prepared @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} in a 4th-level slot with Form Retention, you would cast a 2nd-level animal form that lasts for up to 10 minutes. If the spell can be Dismissed, that doesn't change.

Assurance (Diplomacy).name: Assurance (Diplomacy)
Assurance (Diplomacy).description: Even in the worst circumstances, you can perform basic diplomacy tasks. You can forgo rolling a skill check for diplomacy to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

Advanced Wilding.name: Advanced Wilding
Advanced Wilding.description:
You gain one druid feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your druid level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another druid feat.

Armored Stealth.name: Armored Stealth
Armored Stealth.description:
You have learned techniques to adjust and modify your armor and movements to reduce the noise you make.

When you wear non-noisy armor with which you are trained, your penalty to Stealth checks is reduced by 1 (to a minimum penalty of 0). If you're a master in Stealth, reduce the penalty by 2, and if you're legendary, reduce the penalty by 3.

If your armor has the noisy trait, instead of reducing the penalty to Stealth checks, you ignore the effects of the noisy trait, enabling you to remove the penalty with a sufficient Strength score as normal.

First Revelation (Bones Mystery).name: First Revelation (Bones Mystery)
First Revelation (Bones Mystery).description:
You gain your mystery's initial revelation spell (@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.D6T17BdazhNy3KPm]{Soul Siphon}). Casting this spell progresses your @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.ibX2EhKkyUtbOHLj]{Oracular Curse}. Use the minor curse from your mystery, but when you progress it again, instead of your mystery's moderate curse effect, you become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} in addition to the effects of the minor curse.

If you don't have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OSefkMgojBLqmRDh]{Refocus} by reconciling the conflicting nature of your mystery, which also reduces your curse to minor.

Minor Curse of Bones

Bones protrude through your skin and your flesh rots, combining with a stench of decay and an unearthly chill. Non-magical effects that would restore your Hit Points only grant you half as many HP as normal.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.whf92aQ6aMwByjFn]{Effect: Minor Bones Curse}

Shining Oath (Liberator).name: Shining Oath (Liberator)
Shining Oath (Liberator).description:
You've sworn an oath to put the undead to rest. Add the following tenet to your champion's code after the other tenets: "You must end the existence of undead you encounter as long as you have a reasonable chance of success; in the unlikely event you find a good undead, you can try to work out a more peaceful way to help it recover from its undead state rather than destroying it in combat, such as helping it complete its unfinished business and find peace."

If you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IX1VlVCL5sFTptEE]{Liberating Step} triggered by an undead, your ally gains a +4 circumstance bonus to checks granted by your Liberating Step, and the ally can Step twice afterward.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.ZnKnOPPq3cG54PlG]{Effect: Liberating Step (vs. Undead)}

You don't consider undead to be legitimate authorities, even in nations ruled by undead.

Schooled In Secrets.name: Schooled In Secrets
Schooled In Secrets.description:
You notice the signs and symbols that members of mystery cults and other secret societies use to declare their affiliation to fellow members.

You can use Occultism in place of Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} about such groups. If you belong to a secret cult, lodge, sect, or similar organization, you automatically recognize members of your group unless they are specifically attempting to conceal their presence from you.

Lucky Break.name: Lucky Break
Lucky Break.description:
You catch yourself as you make a mistake. You can trigger @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.7qBuzHY8kEG8SdEP]{Cat's Luck} when you fail or critically fail on an Athletics or Acrobatics skill check, in addition to its normal trigger. When you do, you reroll the triggering skill check and use the better result.

This still counts against Cat's Luck's frequency, as normal.

Munitions Crafter.name: Munitions Crafter
Munitions Crafter.description:
Bullets and bombs can be scarce in some parts, so you've learned to make your own. You become trained in Crafting and gain the alchemist's infused reagents class feature, gaining a number of reagents each day equal to your level. You also gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} feat and four additional formulas for 1st-level alchemical items.

You gain infused reagents (a pool of reagents usable to make alchemical items) and advanced alchemy (allowing you to make alchemical items during your daily preparations without the normal cost or time expenditure). You gain batches of infused reagents per day equal to your level, which you can use to create only bombs or alchemical ammunition. Your advanced alchemy level for creating these is 1 and doesn't increase on its own. If you use a batch of infused reagents to create basic level-0 ammunition such as black powder cartridges or black powder doses, you produce 10 rounds of ammunition.

Virtuosic Performer.name: Virtuosic Performer
Virtuosic Performer.description: You have exceptional talent with one type of performance. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making a certain type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. Select one of the following specialties and apply the bonus when attempting Performance checks of that type. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.

Energy Ward.name: Energy Ward
Energy Ward.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a

non-cantrip spell that dealt energy damage.

You trap energy from the last spell you cast within your body, coating your flesh in a protective ward. Until the start of your next turn, you gain resistance 5 to one type of energy damage dealt by the spell you just cast.

Cast Down.name: Cast Down
Cast Down.description:
The sheer force of your faith can bring a foe crashing down.

If the next action you use is to cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} to damage one creature, the target is knocked prone if it takes any damage from the spell. If the target critically fails its save against the spell, it also takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute.

Prescient Consumable.name: Prescient Consumable
Prescient Consumable.description: You can predict which consumables you might need in advance. When using Prescient Planner, you can procure a consumable item from your backpack, instead of a piece of adventuring gear. The consumable item must still be common with a level no higher than half your level, and its Bulk must be low enough that carrying it wouldn't have made you encumbered.

Incredible Improvisation.name: Incredible Improvisation
Incredible Improvisation.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You attempt a check using a skill you're untrained in

A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience. Gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering skill check.

Master Scroll Cache.name: Master Scroll Cache
Master Scroll Cache.description:
Your scroll collection is incredible, brimming with eldritch power, and you can prepare far more of them than an ordinary scroll trickster.

In addition to your daily scrolls from the Basic and Expert Scroll Caches, add a single scroll with a 6th-level spell. At 20th level, add a scroll with a 7th-level spell.

Rebounding Assault.name: Rebounding Assault
Rebounding Assault.description:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm or loaded crossbow in one hand and a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in the other.

You hurl your melee weapon at an opponent, then fire a bullet into the weapon's hilt, making it deal additional damage and bounce back to your grasp. Make a thrown ranged Strike with the melee weapon, then a ranged Strike with your firearm. Both Strikes use the same multiple attack penalty. If the melee weapon doesn't already have the thrown trait, it gains the thrown 10 feet trait during a Rebounding Assault.

If both attacks are successful, the bolt or bullet hits the thrown melee weapon instead of your target, adding its force into one attack. Combine the damage from both Strikes, using the thrown weapon's damage type, and add an additional [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 precision damage}. The impact sends the melee weapon rebounding off the target and back to your hand.

In any circumstance other than both attacks hitting, carry out the individual Strikes normally. The thrown weapon doesn't rebound and remains in the target's space as normal for thrown weapons.

Snare Hopping.name: Snare Hopping
Snare Hopping.description: You can magically move your snares around. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dDt8VFuLuhznT19v]{Snare Hopping} warden spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Martial Exercise.name: Martial Exercise
Martial Exercise.description: You've become comfortable in using weapons that you might not have picked up before training with the Swords. Choose one weapon group, such as hammer or sword. Whenever your proficiency rank in any weapon increases to expert or beyond, you also gain that new proficiency rank with both simple and martial weapons of your chosen weapon group.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you. You ignore any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede your progress.

Occult Evolution.name: Occult Evolution
Occult Evolution.description: Glimpses of the obscure secrets of the universe loan you power. You become trained in one skill of your choice. Additionally, once per day, you can spend 1 minute to choose one mental occult spell you don't know and add it to your spell repertoire. You lose this temporary spell the next time you make your daily preparations (though you can use this ability to add it again later).

Strangle.name: Strangle
Strangle.description:
Requirements You have a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

You twist and squeeze the breath out of your foe. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. On a success, you gain a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice and the target can barely speak until the start of your next turn or until it Escapes, whichever comes first. While it can barely speak, the target can't vocalize above a hoarse whisper, and it must succeed at a Flat Check or lose any action that requires speech, For an action requiring speech that is also a manipulate action, like Casting a Spell with somatic and verbal components, the target just rolls a single Flat Check, rather than an additional Flat Check for being grabbed.

Warding Rune (Conjuration).name: Warding Rune (Conjuration)
Warding Rune (Conjuration).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Critical Debilitation.name: Critical Debilitation
Critical Debilitation.description:
Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bp0Up04x3dzGK5bB]{Debilitating Strike}, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from.

Debilitation: The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected.

Success: The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure: The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure: The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of your next turn.

Spellmaster's Tenacity.name: Spellmaster's Tenacity
Spellmaster's Tenacity.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You critically fail at a saving throw against a foe's spell, and that spell was cast or created with the tradition of magic you selected with the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.dWkf6LhYBfBkeyOA]{Spellmaster's Resilience} feat.

You call upon the power of your spells to protect you from the worst of the magic headed your way. You fail your saving throw instead of critically failing. For 1 minute, increase the circumstance bonus to saving throws from the Spellmaster's Resilience feat to +2, and increase the resistance to damage it grants to 10.

Charlatan.name: Charlatan
Charlatan.description: You've learned to mimic the abilities of spellcasters by studying their flourishes and words. When you activate a magic item to generate a spell effect, attempt a Deception check. If you succeed against an onlooker's Perception DC, to that onlooker, you appear to cast that spell instead. Onlookers who successfully recognize the spell realize you used a magic item, though those who later successfully identify the magic still can't determine that the source of the effect was a magic item.

Ancillary Motes.name: Ancillary Motes
Ancillary Motes.description:
You can use @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.Ewk7h9aQpKvy1RJo]{Crystalline Dust} one more time per day.

Special You can take this feat more than once, gaining one more use of Crystalline Dust per day each time.

No Escape.name: No Escape
No Escape.description: You keep pace with a retreating foe. Stride up to your Speed, following the foe and keeping it in reach throughout its movement until it stops moving or you've moved your full Speed. You can use No Escape to Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Stride if you have the corresponding movement type.

Sprite's Spark (Firefly Sprite).name: Sprite's Spark (Firefly Sprite)
Sprite's Spark (Firefly Sprite).description:
You can fling a portion of your magic at foes. You gain a ranged unarmed attack in the sling weapon group with a maximum range of 20 feet that deals [[/r 1d4]] damage. (No ability modifier is added to the damage roll.) The damage type and name of the unarmed attack depends on your heritage, described below; most sprite heritages not presented in this book also use luminous spark. Like other unarmed attacks, you can improve this attack with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.FNDq4NFSN0g2HKWO]{Handwraps of Mighty Blows}.

Draxie euphoric spark (mental)

Firefly Sprite luminous spark (fire)

Grig dissonant note (sonic)

Melixie sting shot (poison)

Nyktera ultrasonic pulse (sonic)

Pixie pixie dust (mental)

Sustaining Steel.name: Sustaining Steel
Sustaining Steel.description:
Trigger You Cast a Spell using a spell slot.

Requirements You're in Arcane Cascade stance.

You pull magic into your weapon, using its substance to transform the magic into restorative energy. You regain Hit Points equal to double the spell's level and roll to end any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Negative Damage} you have.

If the spell was of the necromancy school, any persistent negative damage you have ends automatically, and you can change the damage type from Arcane Cascade to positive if you wish. (Positive damage typically damages only undead or other creatures with @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x]{Negative Healing}.)

Energy Resistance.name: Energy Resistance
Energy Resistance.description: Your eidolon has stronger resistance. Its resistance from Energy Heart and Dual Energy Heart increase to your level.

Focused Juggler.name: Focused Juggler
Focused Juggler.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.8vuL2hCPrcG2duLt]{Juggler}

Trigger Your turn begins.

You continue Juggling until the end of your next turn. Increase the maximum number of items you can juggle by one.

Swashbuckler's Riposte.name: Swashbuckler's Riposte
Swashbuckler's Riposte.description: You've learned to riposte against ill-conceived attacks. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EfjoIuDmtUn4yiow]{Opportune Riposte} reaction.

Effortless Captivation.name: Effortless Captivation
Effortless Captivation.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You maintain your innate enchantments and illusions with hardly a thought. You immediately gain the effects of the Sustain a Spell action, which you can use only to extend the duration of an enchantment or illusion spell.

Dracomancer.name: Dracomancer
Dracomancer.description:
Your inborn arcane power manifests as your exemplar's most time-honored spells.

Choose one 1st-level spell and one 2nd-level spell from those listed for a dragon spellcaster of your draconic exemplar's type (such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4WAib3GichxLjp5p]{Alarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike} for a black dragon exemplar).

You can cast each of these spells once per day as arcane innate spells. You gain the trained proficiency rank in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your key spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Dragon Transformation.name: Dragon Transformation
Dragon Transformation.description:
You transform into a ferocious Large dragon, gaining the effects of 6th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5c692cCcTDXjSEzk]{Dragon Form} except that you use your own AC and attack modifier, you apply your extra damage from Rage, and the Breath Weapon uses your class DC. The action to Dismiss the transformation gains the rage trait.

At 18th level, you gain a +20-foot status bonus to your fly Speed, your damage bonus with dragon Strikes increases to +12, and you gain a +14 status bonus to your breath weapon damage.

Munitions Machinist.name: Munitions Machinist
Munitions Machinist.description: You're particularly adept at crafting ammunition and bombs. Your advanced alchemy level for ammunition and bombs increases to your level – 3.

Resounding Finale.name: Resounding Finale
Resounding Finale.description:
Trigger You or an ally benefiting from your composition spell would take sonic damage.

You bring your performance to a sudden, dramatic finish, drowning out other sounds. Your composition spell ends immediately, and all allies that had been benefiting from the spell's effects gain sonic resistance against the triggering damage equal to twice the composition spell's level.

Quah Bond.name: Quah Bond
Quah Bond.description:
Access Shoanti ethnicity

You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the skill listed for your quah (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.W6Gl9ePmItfDHji0]{Assurance} skill feat in that skill, as the spirits' help guides your actions.

  • Lyrune-Quah: Religion
  • Shadde-Quah: Athletics
  • Shriikirri-Quah: Nature
  • Shundar-Quah: Diplomacy
  • Sklar-Quah: Intimidation
  • Skoan-Quah: Medicine
  • Tamiir-Quah: Acrobatics

Divine Ally.name: Divine Ally
Divine Ally.description: You gain a divine ally of your choice.

Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
Intimidating Strike.description:
Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence.

Make a melee Strike. If you hit and deal damage, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit.

Visual Fidelity.name: Visual Fidelity
Visual Fidelity.description:
You've found a way to use a hodgepodge combination of devices to enhance your visual abilities in every situation. You gain darkvision and low-light vision, and you can see @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and objects as translucent shapes, though these shapes are indistinct enough to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to you.

If an effect would give you the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} condition, the effect must attempt a counteract check against your class DC, with your counteract level equaling half your level, rounded up. On a failed counteract check, you aren't blinded-your various devices are able to compensate.

Discerning Gaze.name: Discerning Gaze
Discerning Gaze.description:
You have a sense for when people are lying. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on your secret Perception checks to Sense Motive.

If you use Sense Motive on a creature you have currently condemned with Harsh Judgment, your GM rolls the Perception check twice and takes the higher result (this is a fortune effect).

Rain of Bolts.name: Rain of Bolts
Rain of Bolts.description:
Frequency once per day Throughout the day, your body produces powerful projectiles within your chassis.

You fire them all at once in either a 30-foot cone or a 10-foot emanation. Foes in the area take [[/r {6d6}[piercing]]]{6d6 piercing damage}. This increases to 7d6 at 12th level, 8d6 at 15th level, and 9d6 at 18th level.

Enhancement The projectiles regenerate quicker, they are much more powerful, and you can refine the metallic content to harm certain creatures. You can use Rain of Bolts once per hour instead of once per day. The damage increases to 12d6 and each time you use the action, you can choose adamantine, cold iron, or silver. The damage from Rain of Bolts is treated as the metal you chose. At 20th level, the damage increases to 13d6.

Stone Communion.name: Stone Communion
Stone Communion.description: You gain a unique communion with the earth and stones. You learn the Terran language and you can Activate your ka stone with a 10-minute activation (envision) to cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YIMampGpij4Y30yE]{Stone Tell}.

Resuscitate.name: Resuscitate
Resuscitate.description:
Requirements You are holding healer's tools or are wearing them and have a hand free. Also, the target's body is mostly intact.

You can use Medicine to resuscitate the dead. Attempt a DC 40 Medicine check to revive a dead creature that has been dead for no more than 3 rounds. If you succeed, the target returns to life with the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}, except it still has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition it had before @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, increased by 1 (or wounded 1 if it wasn't wounded before dying). Whether you succeed or fail, the target is temporarily immune to Resuscitate for 1 day.

Cartwheel Dodge.name: Cartwheel Dodge
Cartwheel Dodge.description:
Requirements You aren't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} or overburdened.

Trigger You succeed or critically succeed at a Reflex saving throw.

You Step up to 10 feet.

Alchemical Familiar.name: Alchemical Familiar
Alchemical Familiar.description: You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood. This alchemical familiar appears to be a small creature of flesh and blood, though it might have some unusual or distinguishing aspects depending on your creative process. Like other familiars, your alchemical familiar assists you in your laboratory and on adventures. The familiar uses your Intelligence modifier to determine its Perception, Acrobatics, and Stealth modifiers.

Unexpected Sharpshooter Dedication.name: Unexpected Sharpshooter Dedication
Unexpected Sharpshooter Dedication.description:
Frequency once per day

Who needs skill when you've got dumb luck? Sometimes your shots hit miraculously, regardless of the fact that you seemed to slip when you pulled the trigger or that you weren't aiming at your foe when you fired. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.FzZAYGib08aEq5P2]{Accidental Shot} activity.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the unexpected sharpshooter archetype.

Bloodletting Claws.name: Bloodletting Claws
Bloodletting Claws.description: Your eidolon inflicts bleeding wounds on a telling blow. If your eidolon critically hits with a melee unarmed Strike that deals slashing or piercing damage, its target takes [[/r 1d6 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}. Your eidolon gains an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the unarmed attack's item bonus to attack rolls. This is a critical specialization effect.

Smokesoul.name: Smokesoul
Smokesoul.description: You have a connection to smoke and haze. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pTHMZLqWDJ3lkan9]{Smoke Blending} reaction.

Advanced Synergy.name: Advanced Synergy
Advanced Synergy.description:
You gain one summoner feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your summoner level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another summoner feat.

Summon Earth Elemental.name: Summon Earth Elemental
Summon Earth Elemental.description: You have a connection to the Inner Sphere, allowing you to summon an elemental ally. Once per day, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj]{Summon Elemental} as a 5th-level primal innate spell, but the elemental summoned must be an earth elemental.

Eldritch Researcher Dedication.name: Eldritch Researcher Dedication
Eldritch Researcher Dedication.description:
You gain the ability to cast a single arcane or occult cantrip of your choice (which is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up). If you weren't already, you become trained in that tradition's spell DCs and spell attack rolls with Intelligence as your spellcasting ability.

Regardless of whether you choose an arcane or occult cantrip, you also become an expert in your choice of either Arcana or Occultism. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks you attempt with the chosen skill when Investigating or Identifying Magic.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the Eldritch Researcher archetype.

Advanced Fury.name: Advanced Fury
Advanced Fury.description:
You gain one barbarian feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your barbarian level is equal to half your character level.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another barbarian feat.

Runescarred Dedication.name: Runescarred Dedication
Runescarred Dedication.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.RyjrUkqSIg52Mjl8]{Runescarred}

Access You are from the Saga Lands.

Whether through blood (if you're Varisian, Shoanti, or New Thassilonian) or by exposure to rune magic, you have become runescarred, with visible, glowing runes on your body in the form of tattoos or scars. You might have possessed these marks before gaining the archetype, but you only truly became runescarred when you chose to study and tap into the runes' power. You become an expert in Arcana and you also become trained in Thassilon Lore, or an expert in Thassilon Lore if you were already trained in it.

Choose one cantrip from the arcane list. One of the runes on your body corresponds to the chosen cantrip, and you can cast the chosen cantrip as an innate arcane spell.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the runescarred archetype.

Gigavolt.name: Gigavolt
Gigavolt.description: When you unleash electricity from your innovation, you can bounce it off obstacles, creating a field of electric death. When you use Megavolt, each time your line of electricity hits a solid barrier, such as a wall, it bounces off at an angle of your choice and continues until you have reached the full length of the line. Even if a creature is in the area from multiple bounces, it takes the damage only once.

Cooperative Nature.name: Cooperative Nature
Cooperative Nature.description: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to Aid.

Wash Out.name: Wash Out
Wash Out.description: Toxins seep out of your artificial body quickly. Each time you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing poison, you reduce its stage by 2, or by 1 against a virulent poison. Each critical success you achieve against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 against a virulent poison.

Expert Beast Gunner Spellcasting.name: Expert Beast Gunner Spellcasting
Expert Beast Gunner Spellcasting.description: You've learned the deeper secrets of beast guns, making you an expert in the magic they grant you. You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

Loremaster Dedication.name: Loremaster Dedication
Loremaster Dedication.description:
You've compiled a vast repository of information that touches on nearly every subject. You are trained in Loremaster Lore, a special Lore skill that can be used only to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, but on any topic.

If you have legendary proficiency in a skill used to Decipher Writing, you gain expert proficiency in Loremaster Lore, but you can't increase your proficiency rank in Loremaster Lore by any other means.

You can take feats in the loremaster's additional feats entry even if you don't meet the @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.4ripp6EfdVpS0d60]{Enigma Muse} prerequisite.

If you have the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.uVXEZblPRuCyPRua]{Bardic Lore} class feat, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks with Bardic Lore.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the loremaster archetype.

Follow-up Strike.name: Follow-up Strike
Follow-up Strike.description:
Requirements Your last action was a missed @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} with a melee unarmed attack.

You have trained to use all parts of your body as a weapon, and when you miss with an attack, you can usually continue the attack with a different body part and still deal damage.

Make another Strike with a melee unarmed attack, using the same multiple attack penalty as for the missed Strike, if any.

Miracle Worker.name: Miracle Worker
Miracle Worker.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Your alchemical mastery can resuscitate the recently slain. You can administer a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qK964kZz1ALcysOa]{True Elixir of Life} to a creature who has been dead for no more than 2 rounds. When you do, that creature is immediately returned to life with 1 Hit Point and becomes wounded 1.

Animal Trainer Dedication.name: Animal Trainer Dedication
Animal Trainer Dedication.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.kisnuKPMGheORROU]{Animal Trainer}

You gain the services of a young animal companion that travels with you and obeys simple commands as best as it can. This trained animal is trained in Performance instead of the skill listed for its type.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the animal trainer archetype.

Eldritch Nails.name: Eldritch Nails
Eldritch Nails.description:
Your nails are supernaturally long and sharp.

You gain a nails unarmed attack that deals [[/r {1d6}[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage}. Your nails are in the brawling group and have the agile and unarmed traits. You can etch your nails with runes with the same cost and restrictions as for etching runes onto @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.FNDq4NFSN0g2HKWO]{Handwraps of Mighty Blows}; runes etched onto your nails apply to nails unarmed attacks with both hands but not to other unarmed attacks.

You can deliver hexes through your nails. When you successfully cast a non-cantrip hex that requires 2 actions or more to cast and that doesn't require a spell attack roll, if your target is within your reach, as part of the spellcasting activity you can make a nails @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} against the foe before applying any effects of the hex. If this Strike misses, the hex has no effect.

Sense Allies.name: Sense Allies
Sense Allies.description: Like many humans raised in a close-knit community, you have always been strongly attuned to the presence of others. Willing allies that you are aware of within 60 feet that would otherwise be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by you are instead @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from you. The flat check for you to target willing allies within 60 feet that are hidden from you is 5 instead of 11.

Cunning Tinker.name: Cunning Tinker
Cunning Tinker.description: Time spent tending to your own form has unlocked your ability to fix other things. You can cast 1st-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dINQzhqGmIsqGMUY]{Mending} once per day as an arcane innate spell. At 7th level, the spell is heightened to 2nd level, and every 3 levels thereafter, the spell is heightened an additional spell level. Even though you're alive and not an object, and you can't normally recover Hit Points from effects that repair objects (like the Repair skill), you can target yourself with this innate spell and use it to recover Hit Points.

Rugged Survivalist.name: Rugged Survivalist
Rugged Survivalist.description: You've studied survival skills with the School of Swords experts and are comfortable spending long periods of time in the wilderness. You don't get fatigued more quickly due to precipitation during overland travel, though you can otherwise be fatigued as normal. You can go 3 days + your Constitution modifier without water before you take damage from thirst and you can go 5 days + your Constitution modifier without food before you take damage from starvation.

Ancestral Paragon.name: Ancestral Paragon
Ancestral Paragon.description: Whether through instinct, study, or magic, you feel a deeper connection to your ancestry. You gain a 1st-level ancestry feat.

Invoke The Elements (Virga May).name: Invoke The Elements (Virga May)
Invoke The Elements (Virga May).description:
Frequency once per day

You summon an aura of swirling wind and lightning.

For 1 minute, you gain @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against creatures more than 5 feet away, and any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you suffers [[/r {1d12}[electricity]]]{1d12 electricity damage} damage (basic Reflex save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher).

At [[/r {2d12}[electricity]]]{13th} and [[/r {3d12}[electricity]]]{17th} level, this damage increases by 1d12.

Enchanting Arrow.name: Enchanting Arrow
Enchanting Arrow.description:
With a single whisper carried on the wind, you enchant your ammunition to make a foe more vulnerable to your attacks.

Make a bow @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike}. On a hit, the target takes an additional [[/r {2d6}[mental]]]{2d6 mental damage}. On a critical hit, the target also becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The mental damage increases to 3d6 if your bow has a greater striking rune, or to 4d6 if your bow has a major striking rune.

Tupilaq Carver.name: Tupilaq Carver
Tupilaq Carver.description:
Access Erutaki ethnicity

You know the truth behind old stories that tell of sending a fetish of bone and sinew to seek vengeance. These old magics allow you to conjure constructs with ease. Add the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} spell to your spell list. The constructs you summon have a distinct ivory scrimshaw appearance, and if you include a drop of blood, lock of hair, or other portion of a creature's body as part of the spell's material component, the summoned construct gains a +4 status bonus to Perception checks to sense or locate that creature.

Resounding Cascade.name: Resounding Cascade
Resounding Cascade.description:
Trigger You use Arcane Cascade.

When you enter your Arcane Cascade, you disperse the magical reinforcement to nearby allies. You grant the extra damage of Arcane Cascade in an aura affecting all allies in a 5-foot emanation. This uses only the base damage of the stance, based on the ally's weapon specialization; it doesn't use any increase you get from bonuses, the laughing shadow hybrid study, or the like.

As normal for duplicate effects, multiple Arcane Cascades affecting the same creature aren't cumulative.

Improved Swift Banishment.name: Improved Swift Banishment
Improved Swift Banishment.description:
You easily banish creatures with your weapon.

You can use @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.t3unBu3PX6AO0uIW]{Swift Banishment} as long as you have a spell slot of 5th level or higher remaining, even if you don't have banishment prepared. You must sacrifice a prepared spell of 5th level or higher, and the banishment effect you create is heightened to the level of that spell. Your weapon serves as the special material component of banishment, causing the target to take the -2 penalty to its save against any banishment you cast using Swift Banishment.

Instant Return.name: Instant Return
Instant Return.description:
Trigger An enemy misses you with a ranged attack using a type of ammunition appropriate to your weapon (a bullet if you're wielding a firearm).

Requirements You're wielding an unloaded firearm or crossbow.

With a single fluid gesture, you catch a projectile out of the air, load it in your weapon, and shoot it back at the attacker. Interact to load the projectile into your weapon, then make a Strike with the required weapon against the triggering opponent. Since you're using the foe's ammunition, this Strike applies any special effects that ammunition would have (for instance, if it was @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.rKknk8odXDBpON5l]{Explosive Ammunition}, it would explode in a burst of fire if your Strike hits).

Mortal Healing.name: Mortal Healing
Mortal Healing.description: You grant greater healing when the gods don't interfere. When you roll a success to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} for a creature that hasn't regained Hit Points from divine magic in the past 24 hours, you get a critical success on your check instead and restore the corresponding amount of Hit Points.

True Shapeshifter.name: True Shapeshifter
True Shapeshifter.description: You transcend the limitations of form. While under the effects of wild shape, you can change into any other form on your wild shape list; if the durations of the forms would vary, use the shorter of the two durations. Once per day, you can transform into a kaiju, with the effects of nature incarnate; if you have Plant Shape, you can instead transform into a green man.

Mega Bomb.name: Mega Bomb
Mega Bomb.description:
Requirements You are holding an infused alchemical bomb you crafted, with a level at least 3 lower than your advanced alchemy level

You add an incredibly powerful additive to a held bomb to create a mega bomb, greatly increasing its area and power.

You use an @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action to throw the mega bomb, rather than Strike, and you don't make an attack roll.

The mega bomb affects creatures in a 30-foot-radius burst, centered within 60 feet of you. The bomb deals damage as if each creature were the primary target, with a basic Reflex save. On a failed save, a creature also takes any extra effects that affect a primary target (such as flat-footed from bottled lightning). While all targets in the area take splash damage as primary targets, there is no further splash beyond that area.

If your next action after creating a mega bomb isn't an Interact action to throw it, the mega bomb denatures and loses all effects.

Juggler Dedication.name: Juggler Dedication
Juggler Dedication.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.8vuL2hCPrcG2duLt]{Juggler}

You become trained in Performance; if you were already trained in Performance, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.AYb8PmGJ37HwIMwj]{Juggle} skill feat, even if you don't meet its prerequisites.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained one other feat from the juggler archetype.

Ratfolk Lore.name: Ratfolk Lore
Ratfolk Lore.description:
Years of experience among ratfolk communities have made you nimble, and you've learned to run and hide when enemies threaten.

You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Ratfolk Lore.

Tools Of The Trade.name: Tools Of The Trade
Tools Of The Trade.description:
You're well-versed in weapons that allow you to bring bounties in alive. You are trained with the following weapons: @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.YUzPv0i8d8p2J9yx]{Bola}, @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.TLQErnOpM9Luy7rL]{Sap}, and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.f1gwoTkf3Nn0v3PN]{Whip}. You gain access to bolas. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the weapons listed.

In addition, you take no penalty when making a nonlethal attack with a weapon without the nonlethal trait.

Summoner's Call.name: Summoner's Call
Summoner's Call.description:
Trigger You or your eidolon take damage from a foe or hazard.

Requirements Your eidolon is manifested more than 5 feet away.

In a moment of danger, you call your eidolon to your side. Your eidolon teleports to an open space adjacent to you.

Special This feat has the trait matching your eidolon's tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Impossible Striker.name: Impossible Striker
Impossible Striker.description:
Your attacks are swift and deadly beyond explanation. Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming.

Instead of dealing the damage from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.AbgHCPWOKULeXrJ2]{Sly Striker}, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't flat-footed.

Shared Replenishment.name: Shared Replenishment
Shared Replenishment.description:
When your deity blesses your warlike acts, you can extend that favor to your allies.

You can grant the temporary Hit Points from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.aMef2VM4mSxl0pmy]{Replenishment of War} to an ally within 10 feet instead of gaining them yourself. You can grant these temporary Hit Points to a different ally each time, meaning you might be able to grant them to multiple creatures in a single turn.

Grandmother's Wisdom.name: Grandmother's Wisdom
Grandmother's Wisdom.description: You carry the bones of your ancestors with you, and you can ask them for counsel. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} twice per day as a 2nd-level occult innate spell.

Ranged Combatant (Piercing).name: Ranged Combatant (Piercing)
Ranged Combatant (Piercing).description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 piercing damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

Snagging Strike.name: Snagging Strike
Snagging Strike.description:
Requirements You have one hand free, and your target is within reach of that hand

You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.

Make a Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn or until it's no longer within the reach of your hand, whichever comes first.

Fell Rider.name: Fell Rider
Fell Rider.description: You have trained with your animal companion to become a terrifying, unified juggernaut on the battlefield. Your animal companion becomes trained in Intimidation. If your animal companion uses Support while serving as your mount, it grants you the effects of the Aid reaction on your first Intimidation check to Demoralize on the same turn, even though it can't take reactions.

Silver's Refrain.name: Silver's Refrain
Silver's Refrain.description: You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.xM35hJacTM1BSXUl]{Silver's Refrain} composition cantrip, which aids you when fighting devils.

Scare to Death.name: Scare to Death
Scare to Death.description:
You can frighten foes so much, they might die. Attempt an Intimidation check against the Will DC of a living creature within 30 feet of you that you sense or observe and who can sense or observe you. If the target can't hear you or doesn't understand the language you are speaking, you take a -4 circumstance penalty. The creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your Intimidation DC or die. If the target succeeds at its save, it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and is fleeing for 1 round; it suffers no effect on a critical success.

Success The target becomes Frightened 2.

Failure The target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

Running Reload.name: Running Reload
Running Reload.description: You can reload your weapon on the move. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, then @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact}to reload.

Dueling Riposte.name: Dueling Riposte
Dueling Riposte.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails a Strike against you.

Requirements You are benefiting from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.n7nQQR940OvFbw7T]{Dueling Parry}.

You riposte against your flailing enemy. Make a melee Strike against or attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the triggering creature.

Slip With The Breeze.name: Slip With The Breeze
Slip With The Breeze.description: You create gusts of wind when you jump, allowing you to carry yourself across greater distances. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.ZBhvJ9O8MvBFAlhq]{Quick Jump} and @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.HJYQlmGTdtyGWr6a]{Powerful Leap} skill feats as bonus feats.

Improved Dueling Riposte.name: Improved Dueling Riposte
Improved Dueling Riposte.description:
Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the opportunity presents itself.

At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.mf2cdCRV8uowOMOm]{Dueling Riposte}. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.n7nQQR940OvFbw7T]{Dueling Parry}.

Genius Mutagen.name: Genius Mutagen
Genius Mutagen.description:
Specialized tweaks to your body's chemical composition considerably broaden the benefits you gain from cognitive mutagens.

When you're affected by a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.wbr6rkyaVYnDhdgV]{Cognitive Mutagen}, you also gain the mutagen's item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, Medicine, Nature, Performance, Religion, and Survival checks.

In addition, you can communicate telepathically with creatures within 60 feet with whom you share a language. The communication is two-way once you establish it, so a creature you contact can also communicate with you.

Mimic Protections.name: Mimic Protections
Mimic Protections.description: By adopting resonant reflections, you have learned to copy the abilities of other creatures as well. When you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JYi4MnsdFu618hPm]{Hunt Prey} on a foe within 100 feet, you gain resistance 10 to all damage types that target has resistance or immunity to for as long as the foe remains within 100 feet.

Ghost Hunter Dedication.name: Ghost Hunter Dedication
Ghost Hunter Dedication.description:
Prerequisites Trained in Occultism or Religion

You have focused your training on hunting and defeating ghosts, spirits, and all manner of haunts. Pick Spirit Lore or Haunt Lore; you become trained in this skill. If you were already trained in both skills, you become trained in a new Lore skill of your choice.

Choose two cantrips from the occult spell list. Each cantrip must have the divination, enchantment, or necromancy trait. You can cast these spells as innate occult spells. You gain access to the Cast a Spell activity if you didn't have it already. You're trained in occult spell attack rolls and spell DCs. You can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need a spell component pouch. Your key spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the ghost hunter archetype.

Dualborn.name: Dualborn
Dualborn.description:
Your suli heritage can be traced back to two geniekin ancestors of opposing elements, or to an elemental ancestor that embodied two combined elements. Choose two of the following elements: air, earth, fire, and water. Once made, this choice can't be changed. You gain resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) to all damaging effects with the traits of either of your chosen elements.

Special If you take the Elemental Assault or Elemental Bulwark ancestry feats, you can use them only with your chosen elements. You can add your resistance from this feat to the resistance you gain from Elemental Bulwark against effects with your elements' traits, for a total of 5 + half your level, or 10 + half your level with Improved Elemental Bulwark. If you take the Tetraelemental Assault feat, you can choose each of your two elements twice each, instead of choosing each of the four elements once each.

Battleforger.name: Battleforger
Battleforger.description: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments. By spending 1 hour working on a weapon or armor, you can grant it the effects of a +1 potency rune until your next daily preparations, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls for a weapon or increasing armor's item bonus to AC by 1. This has no effect if the weapon or armor already had a potency rune.

Widen the Gap.name: Widen the Gap
Widen the Gap.description: Once you have penetrated a foe's defenses, you can home in on the same spot to exploit your opponent's wound and deal some serious damage. The second time you hit and deal damage with a melee axe Strike to the same opponent or object during your turn, you ignore half of the opponent's or object's Hardness, if any. If you hit and deal damage with a melee axe Strike to the same opponent or object a third or fourth time during your turn, you ignore all of its Hardness, if any.

Field Artillery.name: Field Artillery
Field Artillery.description: While castles are generally obliging enough to stay in one place, out in the field positioning is of paramount importance-a gun in the wrong place is worse than useless. You can Interact with an adjacent mounted siege weapon to increase its Speed by 10 feet for one round.

Mage Hunter.name: Mage Hunter
Mage Hunter.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell}.

You use your hatred of magic to lash out at the sight of spellcasting, allowing you to interrupt an enemy's spell. Make a melee @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit, you disrupt the spell.

Beneath Notice.name: Beneath Notice
Beneath Notice.description:
You are skilled at hiding from your foes and targets among the common populace. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.e4KB4pSkx2lDBNw3]{Quick Disguise} and @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.RiuZT3H4QZIIEQXJ]{Slippery Secrets} skill feats.

In addition, while in a crowd, you can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} a nondescript member of the crowd as a three action activity (one action if you are legendary in Deception)

A Home In Every Port.name: A Home In Every Port
A Home In Every Port.description:
You have a reputation in towns and villages you've visited, and residents are always willing to open their doors to you.

When in a town or village, during downtime, you can spend 8 hours to locate a resident willing to provide lodging for you and up to six allies for up to 24 hours at no charge. The standard of living within the acquired lodging is comfortable, and square meals are provided at no cost.

After 24 hours, you must pay standard prices for further lodging and meals or use this feat again to find a new resident willing to host you.

Fighter Dedication.name: Fighter Dedication
Fighter Dedication.description:
You become trained in simple weapons and martial weapons. You become trained in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in fighter class DC.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the fighter archetype.

Fancy Moves.name: Fancy Moves
Fancy Moves.description: You show off your fighting style to discourage your foes. You can use Performance to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}.

Magical Trickster.name: Magical Trickster
Magical Trickster.description: Whether you're using magic items, wielding innate magic, or dabbling in spellcasting, you can sneak spells past your foes' defenses as easily as any blade. When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a flat-footed foe's AC and the spell deals damage, you can add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. If your single spell leads to multiple separate damage rolls, apply your sneak attack damage only once per target.

Gnome Obsession.name: Gnome Obsession
Gnome Obsession.description: You might have a flighty nature, but when a topic captures your attention, you dive into it headfirst. Pick a Lore skill. You gain the trained proficiency rank in that skill. At 2nd level, you gain expert proficiency in the chosen Lore as well as the Lore granted by your background, if any. At 7th level you gain master proficiency in these Lore skills, and at 15th level you gain legendary proficiency in them.

Uzunjati Storytelling.name: Uzunjati Storytelling
Uzunjati Storytelling.description: You tell a quick story or begin telling a longer tale. This is most useful when you want to prove your scholarly credibility or impress someone quickly. Roll a check with a skill that can be used to Recall Knowledge in which you have expert proficiency, using the result entry for the Perform action. Like Performing, Storytelling rarely has an effect on its own, but it might influence the DCs of subsequent Diplomacy checks against the observers-or even change their attitudes-if the GM sees fit. This action is not a Performance and cannot be used in place of anything that requires you to Perform.

Runelord Dedication.name: Runelord Dedication
Runelord Dedication.description:
Your rune magic increases, and you practice with your school's associated weapon. You gain an additional cantrip of your chosen arcane school, and each time you gain a level (including this level), you add an additional spell from your chosen arcane school to your spellbook, with the same restrictions as the two spells you normally add.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the runelord archetype.

Force Fang.name: Force Fang
Force Fang.description:
You can turn your attack into an unerring blur of force. You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} conflux spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Demanding Challenge.name: Demanding Challenge
Demanding Challenge.description: If your skill check to challenge a foe is a success, the target of your challenge takes a -1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls (or -2 if you critically succeed) until the end of your next turn.

Legendary Linguist.name: Legendary Linguist
Legendary Linguist.description: You're so skilled with languages you can create a pidgin instantly. You can always talk to any creature that has a language-even a language you don't know -by creating a new pidgin language that uses simplified terms and conveys basic concepts.
